text:
Mango. Citrus. Pine. Orange Amber with a thick foamy white head. Slow fade. Thick lacing. Chunks of foam floating on the surface. Big fruit. A hint of candy sweet. Thick chewy mouthfeel. Resin. Bitter finish with the faintest hint of booze. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
amber color; citrusy hop aroma; intensely hoppy, but still quite drinkable; bitter, citrusy hop flavor; fairly well balanced and smooth for such a hop monster

Bottle into a wineglass showing moderately filtered caramel brown with a finger of quickly dissipating clean white foam. 

The nose shows moderately intense notes of mango, peach, and light tropical fruit (pineapple, kiwi) on a strong caramel malt backbone. Exactly as the description. 

The palate is light to medium bodied and well carbonated Moderately intense flavors of mango, peach, and pineapple with hints of kiwi with a strong yet restrained bitterness followed by another resurgence of fresh fruit on the palate. Alcoholic and hoppy zest all around the palate but still very drinkable.
Tap at cbc16. Golden color and white head. Aroma has tropical fruits, some caramel and malty sweetness in it. Tropical fruits like mango and pineapple, some malty sweetness. Nicely bitter fruity end.

Pra encerrar a noite. 3Floyds Dreadnaught IPA. Ótima west coast, lembra muito centennial na lupulagem. Ótima! 4/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Floral heavy headed hops. Has hints of a triple IPA in its finish. Reminds me of Hop Stoopid with a bigger price tag but also a freshness that sets it apart. Super complex palate which can be hard at 100 IBU but totally pulled off. This is as good as hoppy bears get. Reminds me of Pliney but with less citrus and more mango/tobacco hints.

Bottle from Lous on Hobson outside Naperville.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Deep orange body. Hazy looking with a 1 finger head (more foam/lacing when i pour in my wifes glass) and very active carbonation.

Smell: Citrus fruit, more specifically fresh & ripe mango. Good piney hop smell but not overpowering the other aromas. Very good.

Taste: Im hit with the fresh mango again and i literally get a mental image of eating a mango. A slightly sweet fruit taste with some peach fuzz as well. Some discreet pine and my wife says it has a peppery feel to it. The taste definitely more than backs up the smell.

Mouthfeel: Good balance between malt and hops but tends more to the malty side. Almost no bitter hops which disappointed me a little but nonetheless i cant argue that this is a greatly constructed brew. Very smooth and feels a little juicy. Bitterness opens up a little as it warms.

Had to pick one of these 22oz at a local beer store to see what the hype was about. I can see this being made to compete in beer competitions. Pours a medium to light amber with rich orange hues with a slightly cloudy appearance. The head comes out strong and thick holding its own for about a minute then slowly melting. The hop aromas are very strong and complex. I get pine, grapefruit, pineapple, caramel, juicyfruit, grapefruit (sooo nice!). The flavors here were a little bit of a sad sad dissapointment for me. I have had sooooo many ipas and dipas and I find that most do not get much higher than an 8 for flavor. This one fails to make it any higher. I dont know if its the big caramel backbone or possibly that it has aged past its prime but man, I could or should be even better! Ok so theres the medium pine/citrus/apricot/ slight mango and high caramel backbone with just a ting of alcohol in the finish. Im hoping I just got an older bottle of some kind. Medium sweet medium to high bitter finish. Ive made dipas that taste almost the same as this one and most of my beers are on the level of decent. The label says memorable but I may forget...Still though, its on a level that flirts with greatness.......
Everytime I drive to Chicago I load up on the Imperial IPA. A bold original IPA flavour that is often diluted with many new IPAs being brewed.

Tap at Js. Pours a clear gold with a finger of foam that lingers. Whoa! Super fresh on tap. Tons of ruby red grapefruit with light dank notes and tangerine aromas. Clean and crisp on the palate with more citrus and ruby red grapefruit. Light bitterness and good lingering juicy fruit and dank. This was quite a head of its time. Fantastic.

Lots of mango, citrus, then caramel malt followed by quick bitter flavor. A touch alcohol warming at the end. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. 

Znakomity smak chmielowy, dużo słodkich, kandyzowanych owoców.

Bottle, june 25th 2016. Hazy amber body with a huge white head. Aroma of mango, peach, pine, resin. Taste is peachy with caramel, strong bitterness playing with the sweetness. Piney and sweet finish. Very nice
Bomber. Clear amber, white head. Orange zest, citrus, a lot of orange. Bitter, dry mouthfeel. Long aftertaste.

Aroma - big caramel nature with the aggressive mix of pungent and pine hops.
Appearance - the body is a hazed orange. The head is off-white and 2+" and settles very slowly. Scattered lacing.
Taste - is rich with a carameled malt - with a slight candy corn nature. The hops are of the Pacific Northwest variety - pungent, bitter, floral, and piney is the mixture here.
Palate - medium body, oily feel with a thick texture, the carbonation is average, the finish is bitter and long in nature.
Fat på CBC 2016. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, grapefrukt, arpikos, persika, mango, nektar, ljus torkad frukt och honung. Fin maltsötma, torr, stor sötma, fruktig, fin beska.
Draft at Three Floyds. Pours a hazy orangish color. Aroma and taste are sweet with orange and pine hops and a bitter finish.

Intense tropical fruits, mango, papaya, sweet orange, bitter lemon. Clear that, medium, creamy, white head. Heavy bitter. Resin, pine, bitter orange, unripe tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, bitterness continues, dry, alcohol and unripe tropical fruits in the finish. Beautiful IIPA, nice, heavy citrus and tropical fruits in aroma, harshly bitter palate. Keg at brewery, Munster, IN.

Bottled 06/09/16 so 2 months on it. Should still be decent. Pours honey orange, big white head. Aroma is orange, booze, resin, pine, floral notes, some sweet citrus. Flavor is boozy, sweet residual sugar, orange, orange rind, and some pine. Very malt heavy. Clearly a bit past its prime. But still an excellent beer.

On tap at the Brewpub with Patty for dinner on way to south Dakota. Pours hazy golden with heavy white head/carbonation. Aroma is strong hop forward. Tastes like a malt bomb with nice balance of bitterness. Great imperial IPA.

Another one of those beers that I enjoyed a number of times thinking that I had previously reviewed it. This time on tap at Lunar Brewing Co., dispensed to a snifter displaying a clear, golden hue, with a fluffy layer of fairly persistent, soft white head foam, and clingy, wavy spray as lacing. The nose was expressive esters as tropical fruit, pineapple, grapefruit, and pit variety, with some resin, and malt sweetness. Medium+ bodied, with appropriate carbonation, the taste added a pronounced citrus & rind bitterness that lingered, decent alcohol presence, and just enough malt sweetness to smooth and take a slight edge off of both. One of the more "balanced" DIPAs that youll find.
Tap at brewpub. Clear gold color and white head. Caramel, tangerine, alcohol and candied orange. Very sweet with a bight tropical bitterness. Medium body with a bubbly feel.
Tasting session @ Budapest, Hungary. Bit opaque copper, of-white lasting, lacing foam head. Nice hoppy aroma, some floral notes. Great bitter taste, grass and leather tones, quite good. Perfect!!!
On tap @ CBC-16. Hazy golden with a creamy white head. fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, malmelade and hops. Full body with a long bitter sweet finish.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Blue session, København
Pours hazy orange with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus and grape. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long slightly warm, caramel, toffee, citrus and grapefruit finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2016 Tap. Hazy golden color with big white head. Aroma i hoppy, resinous, alreasy fussel oils detectable. Taste is caramel, resinous, booze. Medium carbonation. Not as good as one would expect.
Tap at tap-house Munich. Light candyish citric hop aroma. Cloudy Amber, golden lace. Sticky, resinny, onionny. Medium body, feels under carbonated. Very sticky finish, not something I enjoy.
Tap at Munich Tap House, 8th June 16. Pours amber, big head. Aroma is tropical fruit. Taste is tropical fruit, mango, slight pine. Smooth mouth feel. Drinks below the ABV

Draft @ Mikkeller CBC 2014.
Deep gold, white head.
Off-dry, medium to full body, high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Hoppy, resin, apricot, bergamot, orange peel, grapefruit, marmalade. Nice! (2014-05 backlog)

Bottle, 65cl. Aged for over a year. Sparkling amber with a creamy offwhite head. Unbelievable aromas of fruity hops, caramel, resin, alcohol. Medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation. Extremely smooth and creamy. Medium sweet with medium bitterness. Deep fiery roasted character into an exquisite and complex alcohol finish. Absolutely delicious. Expected it to be more bitter though.

Bottle, 650ml. A clear amber beer with a small white head. Intense floral aroma with citrics, hops, pine and malt. Taste is bitter with a perfectly balanced hoppy character. Medium bodied, dry, astrigent and with some carbonation. Aftertaste of pine resin and malt.

Fat på CBC-16. En stor tung och söt DIPA med mycket honung, torkad frukt, söt nektar, karamell. Jag saknar en humlekick i hela smakregistret. Mer stong ale än DIPA och sötman blir väl stor. Men med det sagt ändå riktigt gott, massiv kropp fina söta fruktiga nyanser. Ändå en liten besvikelse.
Pours golden with a one finger white head. Aroma; Citrus, floral, pineapple, pine, malt and grapefruit. Taste; Grapefruit, pineapple, citrus, pine, floral, pine and some malt.
On tap at CBC 2016. Pale golden pour with a white head. Citrus, tropical fruit and honey, perfectly balanced. Smooth mouthfeel.
Tap @CBC16. Cloudy amber, white head. Fruity, blood orange aroma and caramel aroma. Caramely, bitter citrus flavour. Solid.
Sample at cbc. Pours Clear golden. Aroma is hoppy, balanced. Taste is balanced, lots of hops and malts. Very Nice.

Draught sample at CBC 2016, Blue session. Hazy, golden colour with an amber tint. Creamy, white head. Fruity aroma with caramel malts, hay, floral hops, citrus, spruce and sweet, exotic fruits. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body with an oily texture. Finishes long lasting dry and bitter with citrus fruits and floral hops. Excellent.

Tap at CBC. Pours hazy golden with durable off white head. Very hoppy. Peach, grapefruit, pine. Nice malty caramel balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From Tap. Leicht trübes orange goldenes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Orangen, Pfirsich, leicht hopfig. Geschmack dezent hopfig, getreidig, Aprikosen, Pfirsich.
Draught @Mikkeller bar. Amber color, thick white head. Grapefruit, citrus, hops, pine in aroma. Fresh. Flavor has grapefruit, pine, citrus, hops. Flavorful, hoppy, tasty. High drinkability.
Tap at Mikkeller Viktoriagade, Copenhagen. Colour is clear dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Caramel, biscuit, sweetness, fruits, hops and malts.
Tap at mikkeller bar. Hoppy aroma of citrus, peach and tropical fruits. Malty aroma of caramel. The flavours starts sweet but finish heavy bitter with long duration. Big flavours. Great beer...

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pours a dark copper with moderate head. Aromas of tropical fruit with perfumey hints and caramel malts. Flavors of bready caramel, dried fruit, and bitter grassy resin. Good enough but hoping for more based on ratings.

Shared 22 oz. bottle. Bottled 4/1/2016. Pours a hazy amber with an off-white head that lingers. Aroma of citrus and peach; very fruity. Taste is fruity, with more citrus and peach, and a solid and sweet caramel malt base. The finish is fairly bitter and piney, but not as much as I expected, given the 100 IBUs. Very nice.

Aroma: hoppy with multiple citrus notes but not as floral as some of my favorites; Appearance: golden, clear pour with enormous white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: much sweeter and less hoppy than expected; very fruity and pretty complex; Palate: medium-heavy body with medium, fruity finish; Overall: good but not as good as ratings would indicate.
Bomber. Pours Golden Amber with off white head. Aroma is Mango Grapefruit piney and sweet. Taste is sweet fruity grapefruit mango papaya with a piney sweet warm finish. Lives up to the hype!

Month old "Bomber": Aroma is up in your face before you know it, caramel, pine, juicy oranges and grapefruit. The taste is unbelievably fruit oriented, with sweet and ripe citrus fruits, ripe pineapple, peachy and pale bread notes. The bitterness that follows is not exaggerated, very balanced and delicate. I could drink this 24/7.

Bottle shared at the 100 Club, Portsmouth, NH. This is a big beer with big flavors, a big, malty body, and a pretty high amount of bitterness at the end. Like a lot of FFF IPAs, its sweeter and fuller than the average IPA, and that big body mixes with the intense amount of hops to create a pretty intense experience.

Bottled 2/1/2016, tasted 2/13/2016. Huge thx to HankDaStank for hooking me up! Dark copper. Thick, dense white head. Beautiful IPA. Effervescent. Huge aroma of tropical fruit. Lacing sticks to glass. Tastes of mango, grapefruit but not sweet. Big body, heavy for an IPA. Lingering bitterness, but its pleasant. Dry crackers. This is a big body, big hoppy, in your face beer.  I figured this was going to be just another over hyped IPA that was going to let me down, but it really is good, and I cant remember having another beer like it.

22 oz bottle from beer temple in
Chicago. Drinking during super bowl 50. Blast of resin on first sip and a hop explosion overall. The malt really stands up as well.

This beer was near perfect in every way. Didn't expect it. Three Floyd's is sometimes overhyped. But put this tasty Dreadnaught in with Zombie Dust and Dark Lord as living up to their reputation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Bottle poured into a snifter..copper with a fluffy white
head..aroma of caramel,bread,resin,grapefruit..tastes 
of caramel,biscuits,resin,grapefruit..medium bodied..
Just ok.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2017 Nice aromas of sweet malts, limes, and oranges/tangerines. Taste is pine,oranges and tangerines, lines. Big caramel backbone, and floral hop crescendo to the finish. Metallic and caramel aftertaste.
Bit opaque copper, of-white lasting, lacing foam head. Nice hoppy aroma, some floral notes. Great bitter taste, grass and leather tones, quite good. (Munster 201510)

Bomber from E. Grand Whole Foods in Chicago. Pour to snifter, hazed orange pour. Syrupy, ripe tropical nose with pine and alcohol sharpness, lots of honey, rind and zest all over. Flavor displays the same; nice bitter linger, fairly sticky body, tons of gooey ripe fruit tapered by an assertive and lingering pine and bitter flowers. Faint bubblegum on the finish as well. A pretty standard but very well-made, well-balanced imperial. A lot of familiar  imperial flavors showcased, but none are overbearing. Bottle may be a month or two old (date is obscured, looks like from August), would like to have it a bit fresher.  Still, much better than most.

Pours copper, awesome sticky white head. Aroma is big citrus, tangerine, caramel malt, and hops. Taste is the same: candy, bubble gum, pineapple, malts and piney hops. It's an awesome IPA. Three Floyd's doesn't disappoint.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bomber poured hazy amber with nice head and lacing. Huge citrus hop aroma with a nice malt balance. Medium bitter flavor. Tasty Imp. IPA!
Big Aroma, Aftertaste Full. This is just an art of IPA, one of the best IMP IPA.What more can I say. Words not enough just try it!

Bottled nice golden cooper. Nice thick head. Has a awesome fruit hops. Have a bitter piney after taste. A caramel malt starts to pop out after a couple drinks. Three floyds hasnt failed yet. Great Imperial
Bottle. Orange gold in color. A big frothy white head. Citrus aroma with grapefruit, peaches and a carmel malt background flavor. A bit boozy, but still very good.
Bottle. Pours fairly clear golden. Nose is sweet. Taste is sweet and bitter. Great.
This is delicious. Slightly hazy appearance. Smells amazing - lots of citrus. Fairly bitter. Slightly floral. tons of dank hoppiness. So good.
Copper Penney, clear and great carbonation. Hoppy aroma and nice booze notes. Very crisp for such a big brew. Biscuit malt added dimension to hops and alcohol. A sipper.

Fresh bottle. Pours a clear copper color with a white head that leaves behind messy lacing after a few sips. Aromas of tropical fruit and citrus, caramel malt, mango, faint bubblegum. Medium+ bitterness balanced with a nice maltiness, light to moderately sweet. Medium+ bodied, average carbonation. Lingering, medium+ bitter finish. Would never pass this one up on tap.

Bottle. Pours in pale body with medium white head. Aroma has a lot of orange sweetness, tropical background. Taste has high citrus bitterness, caramel sweetness, a lot of tropical fruits in the after taste. Body is full, medium carbonation.

Bomber. Nice citrusy hop aroma. Orangish amber color, a little cloudy. White head that dissipates w/pretty good lacing. Taste is very nice. Nice citrus fruit up front, with a nice malt to balance, and a pleasant bitterness in the end. Full bodied. Overall, a very nice IPA that doesnt taste as strong as it is!

Way old backlog from Mikkeller and Friends. Couldnt remember I had this one bit... oh well. Pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is very hoppy, lemon zest, lime, sweet citrus, malty sweetness. Taste is fruity, hoppy, lemony, citrus, some tropical fruits and some malty sweetness in the back.

From tap. Unclear orange amber color with off white head. Heavy hoppy aroma, pine, citrus fruits, grapefruit, tropical fruits, caramel malty. Sweet and heavy bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Yields an amber, sunny clear color, with a solid, fluffy white head.

Smells of ripe red fruits, featuring apple, peach and blood orange, well accentuated by lime rind. Exhibits a resinous sweetness, blending outstandingly well into the beers dough malts. Hoppy fruitiness defines the nose most pleasantly, together with a toffee sweetness on top of it.

Has a lower carbonation, showcasing a powerful mixture of distinct hops and sweet, well pronounced malts, offering the palate up to an extreme, huge but focused IIPA.

Begins with a very soft, aqueous note, bringing riper fruits from the nose to the palate, effectively balanced by bready, slightly earthen malts, which then turn suddenly honey glazed sweet. The prominent malt backbone defines how the hops evolve on the palate from that point on, pointing out features of ripe red apples, mango, water melon pulp and lemon coated peach, still accentuated by a dry earthiness. During the finish, the beer looses its slick sweetness, in favor of a pungent, leafy lemon dryness, pumped up by a bubbly carbonation. Hoppiness reaches its peak at that stage, numbing the tongue for a short glance, returning its initial aqueous characteristic with a well pronounced, long lasting lemon dryness to it.

This is an extreme, and extremely well build, beer. While it inherits typical double ipa features of a resinous sweetness, its tropical hoppiness lurks underneath, waiting just for the right moment to take over the lead. Both ingredients not only blend flawlessly together, but feature an amazing clean, powerful flavor profile on their own.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2016 Backlog from Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Blue pass 2016-05-13 
Definately a huge difference when fresher! Still the same flavours as before but with a great piney and tropical touch to it. Nice!

7/31/2015, Rated: 3,7
Old... Probably not a righteous rating...
A: Apricot, tropical fruit, raisins, dandelions T: Honey, almond, dried tropical fruits O: Quite sweet and not much carbo due to the cellar. Hint of the hops that once was there. Creamy mouthfeel. I imagine its very nice fresh, but its actually still nice.

Bouteille 650ml, gracieuseté de msjpearson, Thanks Mike! Couleur orangée translucide, mousse blanc cassé meringuée laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de mangue, houblon résineux, malt légèrement grillé, pin. Goût de houblon résineux, malt grillé, mangue, bonne amertume, lalcool est habillement camouflé. Carbonatation faible, corps moyen-dense, côté presque crémeux.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2015 7 months old. Hazy amber, big creamy head. Tropical fruit in the nose, along with some caramel and vanilla(?). Not much piney resins. Some berries too. Fruity hops and big malts in a smooth velvety body. Pretty generic yet smooth and well done.

Bottle to glass. Color is mostly orange with white head. Aroma is grapefruit, orange, citrus, sweetness. Taste is super bitter, hoppy, piney, citrus, yum. Drank this on the beach on a hot day, might have been a better choice, but this is still really good.
Bottle - Pours a cloudy yellow. Nose is oranges, tangerines, grapefruit, sweet. Taste is very bitter and malty, oranges, lemons, grapefruits, tangerines. A big IPA that I enjoy drinking.

650 mL bottle poured into a goblet.
Hazy golden body with a nice, strangely tinted head to it. The head itself has a yellowish tinge. Beautiful lacing on the glass and wisps of foam atop the beer. Very hoppy. Lemony citrus that has almost a soapy character to it. The sweetness behind it combines to enhance this. 

That same soapy flavor extends into the taste, but the hops are still abundant. Lemon and grapefruit hops with a sweetness behind it. Very little bitterness in the finish. Perhaps its too sweet, though.
 Nearly perfect body to it. Nice carbonation and a clean finish. Just a hint of bitterness in the finish.It has a strong hop profile, but not quite the hop flavors I like in an IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2015 Original was on tap at Gallos Tap Room. Edit was from bomber dated October 5, 2015 enjoyed October 27, 2015 in a Hoof Hearted Teku. 

Look - Thin head but weak pour in bar. Light apple juice look with clear around the edges. Thin lacing. Unique.

Edit - Head is darker. Very thick bubbles.

Smell - Pineapple. Orange. Grapefruit. Other citrus. Earth. Resin. Barley.

Taste - Bitter and malt complemented well by the citrus.

Edit - Tea. Vanilla. 

Feel - Carbonation. Medium to heavy. Tongue does curl.

Edit - Medium to heavy. 

Overall - I still want a bomber of it. Not what I was expecting. This borders on being a strong ale. Pick it up if you can.

Edit - The bomber is nice. Closer to triple IPA but that is hard to distinguish with a strong ale.
Bottle. Very nice hoppy beer, lots of orange, citrusy, resiny. High bitterness. Not as high caramel as in some of their other ones.

Bottle from Mikkeller web shop.  Dark golden color with medium white head. Aroma of oranges, tangerines, zest, malt. Taste, Malt, oranges, tangerines, orange zest in taste. Long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty.
Bottle at Three Floyds tasting. Pours bit hazy golden color, white head. Aroma of caramel, orange, malty, citrusy, mango. Taste is sweet, medium bitter, caramel, malty, citrusy, orange, tangerines.
Pours hazy golden with heavy white head/carbonation. Aroma is strong hop forward. Tastes like a malt bomb with nice balance of bitterness. Great imperial IPA.
Intense citrus and mango hop aroma. Intense hoppy bitterness balance by the overall fresh happiness. Some alcohol heat. Well balanced malts without any sweetness.

Bottle 2013, aroma of mango and citrus, full bodied but a little thin, not as much flavors as I hoped, but an older bottle, would like to retry

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bright orange pour from bottle at home. Massive grapefruit and Orange aroma. Super hoppy and incredibly bitter. Had this many times but now finally rating it. I remember previous bottles being much better

What a nice beer. Pours dark golden. Nice lacing on this guy. Nice head. Aromas of pineapple, papaya and lemon. Taste is wonderful pineapple and papaya are there. There is some sweetness but it marries beautifully with the bitterness on the end. Not as OVERLYhoppy as I thought. Which is great. The mouthfeel is very nice. Good carbonation. Well rounded and well balanced. One of my favorite Three Floyds beers.

Wow. So many flavors. I get pineapple, and some very tropical flavors. Not super strong tasting, but you can tell its a high abv. Great depth and color. I loved this, had to drink the whole bomber by myself!
Bottle. Beautiful dark amber pour. Very sweet and citrusy on the nose. Get a lot of peach and grapefruit on the palate with a big hop presence. Another FFF masterpiece.
Very nice stuff. Huge citrus head and a great malty backbone. Bittersweet finish with some booze. Pours clear orange with ok head and lacing. Some resin and a hint of mint. Bottle.

A lot of sweet carmel malts up front to match the nose. Then the hops remind you its a west coast brew times ten. Surprising amount of citrus. More sweet than sour, like pineapple and mango. The sweetness from the fruit is almost candy like. Still some classic pine flavor too. Solid bitter aftertaste. Big everywhere!

Bottle. Clear dark amber pour with dense lasting offwhite head. Aroma is sweet with lots of mango and peach. Notes of citrus as well. Taste is very well balanced. There is just enough sweetness and body from the malt to take on the hoppy bitterness but still keeping the freshness to it. You can still appreciate all the complex notes long after you have finished your sip. Quite low carbonation. Beautiful

22 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Bottled 10/31/2014. Slightly hazy orange with almost three fingers of off-white head. Aromas of citrus, floral, booze, caramel. Tastes of grapefruit citrus, a bit of booze, caramel, pine, resin. Medium body with a semi-dry finish.
Smakt på CBC 2014, dette var et klart høydepunkt. Servert på fat av Nick Floyd selv. Beskrevet, i all ydmykhet, som noe av det beste en kunne smake på i verden.
Une parfaite impérial ipa, un arôme de malt caramel et de miel, une amertume résineuse et une explosion de houblon!... un délice!

Bomber to ipa glass. Brilliant orange hue with an off-white head that sticks. Aromatics are pungent and fresh with fruits like easy mango, pineapple, granny smith apple with some malty sugar and resinous bite. The taste is complex; citrus fruits abound with the hops coming in waves against the malty spine of this beer. Im really impressed with this one. You have to get your hands on this ipa if youre any type of ipa fan. Cheers to 3floyds!

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep golden to orange color with a nice off white head. Aroma is incredible, with big tropical fleshy fruit hops. Flavor brings out much of the same, but has a pretty strong bitterness to it as well. Long lingering tropical hop wallop in the finish. An extraordinary double IPA!
Wow what a brew. Mine was a little older then I would have liked at about 3 months. Wonderful copper orange in color with a nice white head. Good smelling and great tasting brew. Enjoy!

UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Clearing the backlog - might as well follow up the Westvleteren 12 rating with a beer I liked even better. On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Dec 2014. Orange/gold pour with a decent off-white head. Malty, orange, caramel, mango, grapefruit - whole fruit basket aroma. Taste is similar, caramel and all those fruits, bittterness comes through later. With the ridiculous amount and quality of beer they had on tap this was the one I came back to, just fantastic, as close to perfect as Ive ever had
From bomber. Pours a hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is fruit and citrus. Taste is mango, citrus, fresh fruits. Medium oily mouthfeel. Lovely mango fruity flavor. Delicious.

Thanks cards04 for this one! Ive been attempting to get my hands on one of these for a long time. Orange copper body with off white foamy head, good retention, nice lacing. Awesome citrus aroma, tropical fruit, maybe passionfruit, vanilla, weed, resin. Taste is perfectly balanced, not overly bitter, some pine in addition to citrus. Overall a fabulous double IPA.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 14.1.2015. Dark amber. Sweetish fruitiness in the nose, rich and a little vinous. Mildly bitter taste, nettle notes, and a little sweet too. Fairly carbonated, medium body, mildly bitter finish. Cool.
Had on tap at 3 Floyds. Flavors of hops, citrus/grapefruit, malt, and resin. Nice deep/hoppy finish. Great double IPA.

Slightly hazy copper color, really dense and frothy white head. Grapefruit, some peach, a little mango, caramel malt, and resin. Moderate amount of malty sweetness followed by pine bitterness. Smooth, carb is a little stifled by the oiliness, and medium-bodied. A bit of booziness in the long bitter finish.

22 oz bomber into a pint a little to quickly. A cloudy light orange color and a foaming off white head just poured over the top and hung around . Lots of citrus and hops, I can see why 3Floyds beers are so hard to get.

22 oz bottle. The pour is an amberish golden color, almost orange. There is a big frothy white head and a beautiful amount of lace and a filmy head left on the surface. The aroma is fruity up front. Tropical fruits with a nice malty follow-up. The hop bitterness here is really hidden until the end. The flavor is much of the same. There is a strong caramel maltiness that pops through and then moves through a bright citrus and tropical fruitiness. The bitterness slowly moves in and is really good. The mouth feel is nice. Thick with a good carbonation and it really clings. The aftertaste is lingeringly bitter, but also malty. Pretty darn good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is malty, sweet fruit, hops, nice. Appearance is a beautiful amber/orange, off-white head. Taste is malty, caramel, then sweet hops, decently balanced between the two. Mouthfeel is nice, soft carbonation, sticky. Overall, this is pretty lovely.
The standard by which DIPA should be made. Perfect balance of alcohol/hops and malt. Grapefruit/citrus taste with just enough malt behind it for flavor.
@ Tap Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Fantastisk arom, fruktig och humlig. Aromen hintar om sötma i smaken. Smaken är väl balanserad mellan sötman och beskan. Eftersmaken hänger kvar länge med beska.

(On tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Dec 28 2014) Pours a hazy deep brownish-tinged medium gold with a dense head of lacy white froth. Aroma bold and fruity but complex, with florals, citrus peel blend recalls more than the standard offering, a bit of tropical mango, some resinous notes, and something like berries, vaugely dank funky Three Floyds character. A little caramel malt sweetness. On the palate, again quite hoppy and complex with lots of citrus resin, zest and pith - seemed like lime amongst the orange and grapefruit, maybe other things too. Strawberry and kiwi. Caramel is moderate and really just supports the hops. Moderately high bitterness builds from the middle on but doesnt obscure the fruit either. Long hoppy finish with basically no alcohol. Medium, slightly chewy body with medium carbonation. Phenomenal DIPA really, nice fruity hop character with lots going on, resin, balanced sweetness and bitterness, avoids being a booze bomb. I could drink this all the time (though not at Swedish prices!).

bottle at home. good citrus notes, appearance is golden delicious. The palate was just okay, i think this may have sat in the store too long. ill need to try this again as I dont think I had it as fresh as it needed to be to justify the ranking. Overall a good beer though
Great nose. On the citrus end of the ipa scale very delicious and hoppy. Hope heads will love this beer!

ivorywhite dense head leaves some lacing. orangeblonde colour. aroma loads passionfruit, mango, tutti frutti chewing gum, yeasty and boozy. taste like aroma, caramel with a long bitter and resinous finish. medium body and carbonation. real tasty dipa, one of the better ones ive had so far. abv and ibus well hidden. bottle 65cl

Bottle at home, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable off white head.
NOSE: pine, hoppy, florar.
TASTE: pine, hoppy, florar, fruity.

Bottle. Pours murky orange with a thin white head that lingers. Typical hop aroma over light carbonation. No obnoxious 1 trick pony hop flavor but not particularly complex either. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours golden orange with a creamy white head. Jesus titty fucking christ. Smells like mango, grapefruit, pineapple, citrus, big dirty caramel malts. Taste is similar - plenty of sticky punchbowl fruits, mango and grapefruit dominating, then finished with chewy, spicy caramel. The mouthfeel is insane, drinks stupidly well for the booze. Fuck it, Im done.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2015 Bottle courtesy of drpolkadots (Note: its three years old!) Red-orange with one cm of off-white head. Aroma is wheat-barley grain dust, light caramel, and some herbal brush. Flavor is much the same: dry malt extract, some resinous hop bitterness, virtually no hop flavor or aroma. Medium, syrupy body, considerable burn. Blah, not a good IPA after 3 years. My apologies to the folks at 3-Floyds who worked hard to make this (apparently) excellent IPA for rating it so old. If you want a better rating, try distributing this to the North East (or just send one to my mailing address!) Your Alpha King is more of an Alpha Peon out here in the land of Kind Titus. Please declare war.
22oz bottle pours a slightly hazy yellow amber color with a bit of head. My favorite hop profile, very easy going and alcohol well hidden.
Really good. Real fruity and hoppy. Great aroma and super easy to drink. Whats not to like.

Lovely unclear dark golden color with a fine off white head that leaves nice lacing down the glass. Powerful grapefruit and tropical aroma. Full body and a nice balance between sweetness and bitterness. Oily texture and a bit dry ending. Heavy sipper this one. Powerful fruity and lovely grapefruit hoppy. Powerful stuff that could easily felled over to the heavy sweet side or harse bitterness. Also well masked alcohol. Recommendable.[On tap at Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen, Denmark]
Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy amber color, white head. Bitter taste with grapefruit, hops, peach, resin and pine. Bitter finish with grapefruit, hops, pine and resin. Exquisite imperial IPA.
Slightly hazy dark golden color with white head. Aroma of tropical fruits and fresh hops. Some mango taste with pineapple notes and caramel backbone. Creamy texture. Smooth bitter finish. Very nice.

1 pint 6 fl oz bottle from Mikkeller webshop. Pours an orange golden colour, foam white head leaving lacing and aroma of caramel, juicy mango, peach, orangey, pine hop resins. Malt caramel flavour, some toffee, alittle biscuit plus lots of tangy fruity notes, tropical mango, orange marmalade, apricot, peach, pine and peppery with grapefruit bitterness. Smooth and slightly oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry spicy tangy bitter finish. Very drinkable, impressive DIPA.
Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Perfectly balanced and the best DIPA Ive had yet.

Bottle to glass at a tasting. Pours a golden orange with a medium white head. Aromas of juicy citrus, pine, and grass. Taste is piney with lots of juicy citrus in there of grapefruit, lemon, and orange. Hints of tropical mango as well, but not as pronounced as the Panzer on that aspect. Another very smooth drinking DIPA from Three Floyds. Finished dry and bitter. Oh so good.

bottle in a trade thanks a lot to my man greg!! shared it with a friend. 3 weeks old. poured a clear amber orange colour with a nice head. bursting aromas of peach, apricots, and a pine forest. its drinking like a peache juice, with bitter hops, mango, tropical fruits, pines, really there is a ton of fruit in this one!! amazing!! it has that really smooth mouthfeel! its living up the hype. just amazing
Very nice dipa served from tap at mikkellers in Copenhagen. One of the best of the style that I have had.

What an amazing well balanced IPA! My only qualm with this beer is the lack of availability of suitable glassware to accommodate 1 pint and 6 fl oz! It pours opaque orange with a white head that lingers around, arousing you with all the aromas of this beer - which are tantalising. Aroma is pine and citrus. Taste is adventure which starts with oranges then transforms into fresh hoppy grass and carries on into caramel with lingering pleasant bitterness. A citrusy bitterness.

Do not hesitate to try this if given the chance, it is everything anyone could want in in IPA!

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 141024. Fruity with lots of caramel and hoppy notes, some sweetness and some grape and pine, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is long, dry, bitter and caramely. A really well balanced and great beer!

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 24/10-14. Aroma: Hoppy, fruity, caramely, pine needles, citrus, touch of mango(?). Taste: Hoppy, caramely, toffee, pine needles, sweetness. The finish is dry and bitter with lovely flavors of caramel and toffee. A well-balanced and amazing beer!

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Bottle from West Lakeview Liquor. Pours a sexy golden orange colour with a firm white head. Superb lacing clinging to the glass. Wow. Aromas of citrus, pine, grapefruit and orange peel. Pine hops and grainy Malts as well. Taste is a heavy pine hop bitterness that holds insanely well. Theres a hint of mango and a caramel malt backbone. Well carbonated. Mouth is coated pure awesome. The perfect beer for my 1000th rating, cheers! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big, big, big. Month and a half old, so may be missing some of the bitter. Very malty finish, but wonderful big IPA opening. Almost a Carmel flavor, which works wonderfully with the bitter. Highly recommend.

Draught almost muddy brown colour with small head. Aroma is fruity of pine and mango, and also dry and hoppy with taste of toffee caramel and citrus, really nice but I think I have tasted better then this.

This is an amazing IPA. Pours a golden amber with a foamy white head that is two fingers. The head liners for some time. Awesome citrusy fruity aromas consisting of mango, lemon, finished with some resinous notes. Flavors of pine, citrus, and balanced with a caramel sweetness. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation, and high level of bitterness. Insanely drinkable!

22 ounce bottle, stamp says bottled on 09/29/2014. Served in a snifter, the beer pours an orange/copper color with about an inch and a half frothy off-white head that stayed around a long time. Theres also a lot of lacing. The brew smells mostly like citrusy (lemon peel, grapefruit, orange) and pine hops, along with some grainy/bready malt. Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also some mango and caramel malt noticeable. It has a nice bitter hoppy finish. Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its coating with a good amount of carbonation. I think its a pretty good overall Imperial IPA, I liked it. $11.99 a bottle.

Bottle @ home. Pours haze golden with a big white head. Aroma is mango, peach and generally tropical fruits. Flavour is grapefruit, orange and some pine. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Finish is well-balanced and medium bitter with grapefruit and resin.

"compared to Hopslam? Not even close. Maybe this had some age on it. It tasted like it did, which tempered down the flavor and aromatic qualities of the hops, and left the bitterness and malty backbone, leaving it as a pretty good but way overrated strong ale. disappointed in this one a bit. 9/10-had a fresh one, which backed up the assumption of age on the first sample. very very tasty and aromatic hop bomb of a beer. Grapefruit rind and quite floral. not really any balance, but still super super nice. comparable to the excellent Maharaja. mid-hi 3 old, 4.5+ fresh. they need to date these!"

Wow, amazing double ipa. Murky orange pour with crazy lacing. Aroma is intense and wonderful...strong mango, pineapple, citrus, and a little pine. Taste is a fruit salad with a little bit of caramel. Sweet and bitter. Piney finish. Really amazingly drinkable for the abv. Amazing stuff.

650ml bottle. Pours a clear golden shade with plenty of white foam. Hops give off citrussy grapefruit notes in the aroma with pine following up. Taste is nicely balanced between sweet caramel malt and bitter hop flavours. Clean, classy and drinkable, but not enough to really grab my full attention.

19-SEP-2014, draft @Mikkeller & Friends.
Very hazy, dark orange with lasting, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma is perfumed hops. Caramel, over ripe fruit.
Taste the same with some earth and fruit. Sweet, malty, hoppy, bitter. Not all up where I hoped it would be but still a very nice drink.

Aroma is tropical fruits, citrus, pine, and slight hint of berries. Flavor is a fruit explosion with a pine finish. Finishes slightly bitter but both malt and bitter even out at the end. Amazing! Best double IPA!

Bottle. Nice amber body with white head. I think the bottle is a little bit to old so there is missing a lot of the aroma. Otherwise a perfect beer wonderful balanced between hops and malts. You dont notice the malts and the Ibus. Even its more than 3 months old a great one.

Amber haze. One finger foam. Dusty passionsfruit pine notes. Intens resinous piny taste. Sweet well hiding in a moderate bitterness. Very dry bitter finish. Heavy body. Probably the most expensive brew bought so far 225 Danish kroner. It's good but that good!!!

So big and so good. Tons of complex hop aroma from pepper to mango. Flavor is an intense resin awesomeness. Really did well on carbonation and malt backbone with slight alcohol warmth makes this a perfect brew

Bottle. Pours an ever so slightly hazy golden with a big off white head. Aroma is tremendous, with sweet hoppy apricots and soft tropical mango, as well as elderflowers, lychee and bittering orange peel. Medium to full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet hops with apricots and mango, bitter orange peel and pine, as well as a nice malt back with toffee. Bitter finish with grapefruit and resin. A fantastic brew! Subtle and easy drinking, yet hoppy and aggressive. Probably the best DIPA ever, and definitely worth the hype!

Poured from a 22 oz bomber from FFF brewpub, bottled about 9 days ago, served in a spiegelau IPA glass

Aroma: HUGE nose of tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, and grapefruit.

Appearance: Pours a very pretty orange-copper with good clarity, nice fluffy white head that dies down and leaves lacing along the sides of the glass. Great-looking beer.

Taste: Follows the nose, massive waves of tropical fruit, peach, and a little citrus hop with a little malt backbone. A little bitterness left behind on the finish.

Palate: Pleasant average carbonation, body is medium but so, so drinkable for such a big IPA.

Overall: One of my favorite beers, period. Im a sucker for tropical hop profiles and this I just love. Its unbelievably drinkable for such a big beer. Itd be wonderful to have everyday access.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm



A  Slightly hazy light orange

S  slightly hoppy but, more so towards balanced. Pine, grapefruit and stone fruits. 

T  Malt body just being there, citrus driven pale ale, again, its not to an extreme, at all, very balanced out citrus character

M  Light, high carbonation level.

O  Expected way more, this is very much so not a top IPA, would like to try bottled, seeing as every single hoppy beer Ive had at Mikkeller Bar has been an disappointment.
Tap på Mikkeller Stockholm. Dimmig bärnstensfärgad vätska med vitt skum. Tropiska frukter i doften, kådig malt i smaken utan att bli för kraftig. Bra!

Fat på Mikkeller Bar. 
Dimmig bärnsten. 
Doftar fantastiskt av tropiskt och kåda. 
Mycket välbalanserad IIPA, fin sötma kraftig beska. 
Det är ju precis det här man vill ha...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On Tap at Taphouse Munich 
Smooth and easy to drink. Well balanced. 
golden, cloudy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, slick feel, soft carbonation,

Tap at CBC 2014. Beer in the glass deep golden, nice head. Fine hoppy-fruity aroma. Starts mild-fruity, wonderful notes of peaches and apricot, mild sweet notes. Finish less sweet, more dry, some bitter notes. Well balanced. Nice one!

What can I say, Three Floyds have created a masterpiece. Hands down the smoothest IPA I've had. Hard to believe the abv by taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours clear orange with thin white head. Citrus and light fruit aroma with hops. taste initial malt sweetness followed by citrus. Thick palate with noticeable carbonation tingle. Finish hoppy, the bitterness comes and goes before it gets unpleasant. Really balanced and well done IIPA, a style Im not a big fan of but I liked this one.

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, red session. 03/05/2014. Bright golden orange coloured pourt with a lasting thin white sticky head. Aroma is lemon citrus, pine, honey malts. Flavour is aggressive smooth, lemon, pine, bitterness. Uber drinkable. Dangerous. Palate is very smooth, melts on the tongue. Good good shit.

Inte mycket till doft ur Mikkeler barens jävla mikroskopiska pytte glas. Åh skitdyr 60 DKr för 2 dl !! Pinsamt. Smaken fruktig krämig med lite alkoholainslag . Lite för hårt kolsyrad tyvär. Behöver hällas i IPA glas .

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2014 Bottles 8/5/14. Cloudy tangerine-orange with a few bubbles and a thin head. Rich candied fruit aroma with a touch of caramel and pine. Flavor is rich and sweet; resin, pineapple, peach, tropical flavors all in one great morass. Long, slightly sweet finish.

Wow. The aroma is so smooth, hoppy, with a tinge of citrus. Georgeous orangey amber, though a little week on head. Tastes like an imperial should, luscious hops, with a touch of sour fruitiness, and the bitter is so smooth and grows on the finish. Now I know why its priced like wine. Well worth it. Yum!

bomber shared. poured a dark orange color with white head. aroma straight up is hops and malt..and hops and malt and hops and hops. the flavor is super hoppy and smooth...the bitterness is somewhat hidden for as strong as this is...love the flavor. over and over. thank you sir may I have another.

Thanks to brad and his co-worker for this opportunity. Pours a hazy yellow with a frothy head. Aroma is very similar to the gumballhead. New shoe leather. Taste is. Balanced for 100 IBUs. Sweet with tropical and citrus notes. Good but not necessarily top 20. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Torpedo bottle. Thx Mike. Slightly hazy dark golden color. Generous head that stays. Aroma of tropical fruits and fresh hops. Some mango taste with pineapple notes and caramel backbone. Creamy texture. Smooth bitter finish. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber from Mikkeller webshop. Pours a clear amber with a big, white head that leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, mango, caramel malt, citrus, peach, boozy and sweet. Taste is mango, peach, citrus, pine, caramel. Perfect balance between malt and hops, the caramel, bready malty backbone balanced up by the hop bitterness. Was a harsh bitterness 30 mins out of the fridge but as it warmed up it mellowed out and sits in a perfect balance. Medium to full bodied. This is truly a well done DIPA.

So this is unbelievable. Totally worth the hype. Havent had too many ipas that are so high in alcohol and so smooth. Aromas are pine, tropical fruit. Flavors are mango, dank pine. Sour tropical fruit finish. Unreal.
Peach, pineapple, sweet grapefruit, lovely bready malt backbone. Another awesome fruity hop-bomb from this outstanding brewery, dangerously high drinkability :)

0.65 l bottle from Mikkeller Webshop. Dark golden to amber, slightly hazy body, with a medium, creamy, rocky, slightly beige head, that leaves a lot of lacing. Amazing aroma, resin, grapefruit, tropical fruits, honey and caramel like malts and the pine notes are as specific as a walk in a pine forest with needles on the ground! Taste follows this exactly. Mouthfeel is medium, slick, with a medium carbonation and it finishes long, bitter, dry, slightly alcoholic, but still smooth, with pine, resin and lemon zest. Propably the most interesting and specific pine aromas in an IPA Ive experienced so far! And still there is a lot more, complex fruit notes and a perfect malt backbone, all in an amazing balance! Indeed a world class DIPA, that deserves the hype.
On tap from Mikkeller Bar @ Viktoriagade, CPH, DK. Hazy orange in colour. Aroma of malts and loads of hops, long bitter sweet finish.

Strapping bouquet; burst out upon popping the cap. Pours amber with thick but small white head. Buckets of grapefruit, tropical fruit, orange. Stock sweet-caramel malt competes admirably. Nothing unusual but phenomenally strong and certainly inviting. The taste is more malt driven (perhaps due to bottle being 10 weeks old). Caramel, toffee and a little honey lead the way. Some light hop presence in middle palate. Sweet tropical fruit before a moderate fruity-hop bitterness. Notably smooth and bereft of any alcohol presence. Complexity and balance are not priorities. But for a malt-driven bold DIPA, its phenomenal.

65 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma and flavour are citrus, pine, resin, and caramel - with a bitter finish. Expensive shit, but worth every penny!

Bottle from Mikkeller online shop; hazy light orange pour with a frothy off white head, aroma has big tropical hop, orange and a hint of pine, taste has grapefruit, mango, citrus, some sweet caramel, pine needles, sharp bitterness, creamy mouthfeel, excellent DIPA.
Fat. Fin trevlig doft med mycket fina aromer. Smaken tung kraftig smak av torkad frukt. Behaglig beska smyger sig in i din mun.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2016 Tap & bottled. Hazy golden body with a creamy off-white head. Aroma is full of peach, pineapple, citrus and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and nice bitter. Medium to full bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A world class brew. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Poured from bomber into large tulip glass. Translucent amber-ish yellow with thick but quickly diminishing white head. Smells like strong fruity hops. Taste picks up where the smell leaves off, more fruity hops, with a sharp, but pleasant bitterness, and some sweet-ish malt in the background. Palate is nice and smooth. Pretty great beer.
Sticky sweet with strong carbonation and flavors of candied orange, pine, and caramelized sugar.

Tangerine aroma. Tangerine and grapefruit on tongue. Mouthfeel is perfect velvet amazing like laying in silk sheets. A very wonderful tropical ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow! A great DIPA from a super solid brewery! Wanted to get my hands on this after having Zombie Dust...lived up to all expectations!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Binnys. Pours a clear gold orange, light white head. Aroma of mango honey peach, pine, juicy bubblegum, resiny hop. Taste is sweet caramel hop, fruit bomb, some honey.. Hugely drinkable. Med body. Very very good.

Pours a nice golden color, big head with a nice citrusy aroma. Lots of lacing on glass. Really hoppy which makes me happy. I dont get the citrus taste I was expecting but a piney alcohol taste is present. Over all a pretty good IPA, Id like to try a little fresher bottle sometime to compare with this one.

Bottle pour. Semi-opaque, orange-peach color in glass with foamy white head that leaves consistent lacing. Lush nose of orange sherbet, caramel and restrained pine. Some tropical fruit in the background. Unexpectedly subtle, but nonetheless, inviting. Does improve on warming. Medium to full body. Huge hop presence. Creamy orange, fresh squeezed grapefruit and slight resinous bite. More sweet than bitter, but plays the full gamut of flavors. Complimentary malt and yeast backings, brings caramel and some straw to the profile. Finishes dry, with lingering orange rind. Enveloping, without being unctuous, on the palate. High ABV never distracts. This is first rate hop juice.

(bottle) pours a hazy golden-amber colour with a few hop floaties and a frothy light-beige head. aroma of rotten peaches, apricots and alcohol, with a hint of herbal hops, some smoked ham, mango, pineapple, subtle vanilla and sugar icing. flavour is mostly mellow vanilla, mango and caramel, with a hint of herbal hops, some roasted malts, alcohol and an earthy medium-bitter finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2015 22oz bottle - pours a orangey gold . Citrus and pine aroma . Taste has a citrus zip with lots of resin . Very good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours orange with white head. Area is very strong citrus- lemons, grapefruit, sweet orange. Taste is really flavorful, lots of citrus hops, long bitter finish, resinous, touch of sweetness but much. A delicious beer!
had on tap. has a citrus hoppy nose. citrus up front followed by a nice bitter hoppy finish. . another great beer from 3 floyds

Fresh bottle. Pours clear orangish/amber with tall white frothy head. Aroma is tropical, citrusy. I like the stone fruit inclusions here. Peach shines through. Taste is great mix of those fruits with some clearly defined hop notes - right amount of bitter, tart, resin - with that caramel malt kicking in at the end. Smooth and almost syrupy. Sweet finish.
Draught at CBC 2014. Hazy orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, alcohol, spice and caramel.

On cask at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Can not remember the finer tones, but this one was too much for me. Not the pleasant, refreshing taste I want from an IPA, no matter if it is called Dreadnaught or not.

Pours a slightly murky golden-orange, nice fluffy white head that breaks into fine lacing. Aromas is a hop bouquet. Loaded with pine and resin, citrus peels galore...lemon, orange, grapefruits. And some hints of sugary sweetness. Taste is just as bold. Lots of tang in the way of the lemon/orange peel....moderate bitterness initially, but becomes more pronounced as it warms. Alcohol is almost completely hidden among the sticky sweet malt bill. Solid DIPA, one that keeps me happy as a local!
甘さは控えめ

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2014 22 oz bottle. Pours a hazy bright golden yellow with thick head that slowly dissipates to lacing. Aroma is pine, full dominating hop bitterness, residual sugary sweetness, and lemon citrus. Flavor is full and bold: Huge hop presence with pine, citrus, and a balance to hide the 10% ABV. Having had this several times, its always a treat, and words really dont do this beer justice. From notes 11/11/12.

On tap at 3 Floyds. Im astounded at the silky mouthfeel due to small bubbled carbonation. Delicious.

Thanks to schlitzfaced for this beauty. Thats what brothers are for! 
pours medium orange with a thick sticy foam. I can easily detect the mango and pear aromas, but there is some caramel poking through. Excellent body. Bitterness cuts through tropical fruit flavors. I can taste just a mild amount of toasted malt too. Finish is dry with plenty of hops left over.
22oz. bomber poured into glass. Pours a hazy orange with a thick head. fairly carbonated. Aroma is citrus, peach. Very Hoppy. Smooth finish, high octane. Very tasty.

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 3rd Session. Pours orange with a nice head, aroma of orange, marmalade and malt, flavor is bitter sweet with marmalade and malt, medium to full bodied. nice

On tap at Mikkeller bar, pre-CBC. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, pineapple, resin, floral, caramel. Taste is light sweet resinous, smooth pine and grassy bitterness. Finish is dry and smooth bitter. Medium, smooth light oily texture, average carbonation. n.

Pours a rusty orange with floating sediment. Aroma is the strongest Ive ever had with mango and citrus hops. Taste starts with caramel but has citrus hops. Aftertaste is bitter, but has hints caramel.

Woohoo, found the notes on this. Im super glad.
I got this in a trade about two years ago.
I poured half of this into a tulip and about the other half into a snifter.
The appearance was a nice looking hazy to almost transparent looking golden orange to brown with a decent looking sediment rolling around and within the carbonation. The head is fairly a white to an off-white sort of fluffiness filling the top of the glass evenly and ends up leaving a decent sort of white foamy lacing all around the glass.
The smell was an authentic sort of citrus hops to somewhat a nice caramel maltiness that doesnt leave anything to be desired. It does what it needs to do.
The taste was a pure bittersweet and does what it should to please the tastebuds in a very nice showing of citrus to caramel-ness coating them. There is a slight aftertaste of bittersweetness, but isnt overbearing. There is a quick dry finish.
On the palate, she sits about a medium with a sipper sort of sessionability to it. The carbonation is quite fulfilling and nice.
Overall, I say this was a great DIPA, well worthy of having again.
Tap. Ahh yeah. Crisp gold-amber. Lacing. Mild floral nose. Hops balance with ABV to give a boozey, floral masterpiece.

Tap sample at CBC 2014. Pours a clear deep golden body with a medium creamy off-white head. Nose is peaches, apricot, rose water, alcohol, parsley, mild caramel, hints of mint, pine and red fruits. Taste is smooth caramel and pine tones, red fruits, peaches, apricot, herbs and hints of spruce and grass. Smooth, full body, medium to high carbonation. Highly fruit and smooth operating DIPA from 3F.
Tap @ CBC14-red. Copper colour. Hoppy fresh lime citrus, pine needles. Full body, bit dirty yeasty. Smooth though, nice.

On tap at mikkeller viktoria. Dark amber color with off white head. Aroma of grass, fruit, caramel and metal. Taste has minerals, rich and heavy flavor, fruit, grapefruit peel with a long, fruity and bitter finish

This pours a hazy, dark amber color with a slight head. The aroma is mild with hops and hibiscus. The taste is surprisingly sweet and floral for an IIPA, but the real bitterness comes in the finish. Extremely well-balanced and tasty making it very easy to see why its rated what it is.

Draft at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Session 3. Pours clear gold with a fluffy, off-white head. Rich citrus on the nose, nice and dank, with tangerine and suggestions of anise. Medium to big sweet flavor with pale bread, sticky ripe citrus, pine needles, grapefruit, lemon. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Lightly warming to finish, with sticky and resinous hops, lots of ripe, gooey citrus fruits. Solid. A ballsy beer, but still damn drinkable.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2014 nuts,miso and konbu.
Golden, amber
Heavy bitterness, light sourness
Sticky, long last.

Pours a medium orange with a one finger off white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruits, sweet malts, tropical fruits, pine, caramel, grassy hops, and some herbal hops. Taste is similar to the aroma but has more tropical fruits and citrus and is balanced out nicely by a nice caramel and sweet malt backbone. Has a medium-full body with a creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderate-very bitter, long, lingering finish. Overall, a excellent DIPA that is just a tad below the best two in the style (PTY and PTE).
On tap at Mikropolis & later at CBC. Hazy golden-orange colour with white head. Hoppy, resinous, grass aroma. Hoppy, resinous, grass taste, with some pineapple. Medium to full body.

Pours Fairly clear amber. White, steady head. Aroma is very exotic, hoppy, smooth, sweet. Pineapple, slight, but Nice earth. Taste is Very grassy hoppy, but not too bitter. Extremely fresh for it's abv, which is very discrete in general. Extremely smooth dipa with a sweet malt character to it. Could be fresher, but man this is good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Mikkellerbar. Pours clear dark orange with a thick, lasting and good lacing pillowy off-white head. Aroma is elderflower, flowery, citrus, pine, caramel, pineapple and grapefruit. Taste is light sweet and moderate bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes balanced, bitter and hoppy. Awesome drinkability.

Citrus and tropical aroma and taste, strong prominent mango, mandarin, pine needles, with great caramel malt base. Gorgeous.
