One of 3fs best IPAs really one of my favorite IIPAs. Great lacing and head retention on a beautiful golden orange body. Great citrus aroma everything you could want in an ipa

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a Three Floyds pint glass. Aroma is hoppy grassy with some orange citrus notes. Apearance is a slight golden amber with a large white head. Taste is semi sweet with some citrus, grassiness, and lemon. Not as citrus as Permanent Funeral. Palate is great, easy to drink. Overall a great beer.

Billed as a hop lover's dream, and it delivers in great ways. Quite hopped, but has lots of malty backbone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I was able to score a bottle when I was in Milwaukee. Pours a nice golden color with nice white head. Pine, grass, hay, and some citrus on the nose. Mainly citrus and pine on the palate, with a grassy finish. Not overly sweet like some imperial IPAs can be.

Great golden in the glass. Intense fruity in the nose, the beer starts intense fruity with great floral hop profile. The mainpart is very fruity, not too sweet, but intense, slightly malty. The aftertaste is malty, floral, fruity-malty. Freshly hopped, Just great. Probably a bit too sweet - but as it is balanced, it is great. --> 12/12/13/13

More clear yellow. Giant piney nose. Very bitter, turns into bubblegum aftertaste. Incredibly acidic, very present alcohol. Medium body, crisp. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2014 Served: 22 oz bottle
Look: pours dark orange. Small 1 finger head. Lacing hangs around. Off white head color.
Smell: very fruity. Lemons and oranges
Taste: heavy citrus. Orange and lemons. Taste fair amount of alcohol. Taste is bitter from the heavy hops.
Feel: light in the mouth good carbonation 
Overall: like it. Good summer drink. 
First Drank: Kim &amp; Mark&apos;s NC May 2012

On tap at Local Option, Chicago. Appearance is murky peach. Aroma is peach, stonefruit, citrus. Taste is everything - pineapple, citrus, sunshine punch. Wow. Big mouthfeel, bitter finish. Brilliant. Resin impresses itself on the palate more and more. Overall, easily one of the best imperial IPAs going round, if not THE BEST.

Hazy golden color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of pine hops, floral, citrus, & some fruit; Flavor of sweet malt, pine hops, caramel, some fruit, and citrus (notably grapefruit); Finish is dry and bitter; Nicely balanced; Well made and very good!

Pour from bottle - orange golden pour with white soapy head 
Aroma - peach, orange marmalade, citrus hops, piney hops, caramel
Taste - fruity sweet caramel entry with an explosion of bitter hops. 
Palate - thick mouthfeel, medium body, semi fizzy. Long bittersweet finish. 

Excellent beer. A bitter monster of a beer but the fruity notes keep it from being overpowering.
Bottle..pour is golden with a thin white...Nose is pine, corn, malty, spice...Taste is pine, malt, corn, sweetness...

My god. I've had Dreadnaught a few times from a bomber (which is awesome in it's own right), but experiencing it fresh at the Brewery on tap is a completely different, and amazing experience. The perfect Imperial IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted from bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with thick white head. Tons of lacing. Big time aroma of citrus hops and some pine notes. Taste definitely follows the nose. Citrus flavors of mango and grapefruit with some piney floral notes. Very well balanced double IPA. Excellent sweet malt backbone. A nice clean bitterness throughout without the bite at the end. Hides the high ABV very well. Very smooth medium bodied IPA. One of the best for sure. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fresh on tap. This brewery releases so many great IPAs that the once peerless Dreadnaught, for me, has fallen down the list. All that said, the quality and approach hasn't diminished and it may still be one of the best of the classic new American double IPAs.

22 oz bottle..Hazy deep amber pour,big lacing white head.Aroma of pine needles and grapefruits. Some caramel malt upfront before the hop resin assault . Pine,mango,peach and grapefruit all in there.Lighter bodied than most double Ipas. Carbonation was low, finish was a long lingering dry bitter hoppiness.

poured from a 22oz bomber into a snifter glass, has peachy/citrus like aroma with a caramel malt background, the taste is similar to the aroma as it has strong characteristics of peach/mango with s bit of citrus, along with the slight caramel malt background, then finishes clean with a slight bitter aftertaste. overall a damn solid Imperial IPA
Amazing smell is sweet and fruity. Golden color tastes of stone fruits and pinapple that goes down smooth with a pine kick on the back. Truly a great Dipa.

Poured from a bomber. Aroma is peach, citrus, orange, tropical fruit, and salty caramel. Flavors are peach, tangerine, citrus, orange, tropical fruit, pine, and salty caramel. Giant hoppy beer, big fan of this one though. Love all the fruity flavors you get from it. Another amazing hoppy beer from 3 Floyds!

bottle via trade. had many times before, but finally rating. Pours a hazy orange with a medium white head that dissipates quickly. Nose full of grapefruit, orange, lemon, mandarin, tangelos, kumquats, all sorts of citrus. Some piney character in the aroma too. Taste is initially a fruit explosion followed quickly by a lightly pithy and firm bitterness. Quickly the hop flavor comes back through in the flavor and then the beer finishes with a light note of alcohol warming, almost in the taste, but more in the chest. moderate carbonation, thin malt character, but just enough for the hops. dry finish. Wowsers. With all the new hops that people are using all the time, its refreshing to have such a well crafted IPA.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 22oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. Aromas of grass, grapefruit, and mango come off the initial pour in strength, with a secondary aroma of milky caramel (kinda like a caramel candy) and some candy fruit notes. Later on into the first pour, some peach and strawberry notes poke through. It pours a clear sparkling honey-gold color which does turn a bit hazy near the end of the bottle (I wasnt expecting any unfermented proteins, so I was a bit aggressive with the pour), this is topped by a huge, fluffy, slightly off-white head thats perfectly content to linger for quite a while; although, when it does finally reduce, it reduces to a very fine film atop the beer, but, surprisingly, it leaves an abundant lacing. Tons of bitter in this one with a substantial sweetness too. I felt like there was even a trace amount of sour, but it was overwhelmed by the sweet and bitter. The full-bodied beer starts off with a mellow floral bitterness up front with some bittersweet grapefruit. The soft carbonation keeps this pretty smooth and creamy going down, with a touch of stickiness on the lips. At the swallow, a sweet caramel and candy fruit make an appearance, but this is quickly overrun by a strong grapefruit astringency. This is a punch in the face bitter, so beware! This bitterness sticks around for the very dry finish; although it does mellow quite a bit - either that, or your palate just becomes adjusted to it. The aftertaste has some resin to it, and it has an almost burnt bread quality to go along with the grapefruit. As the mouth coat mellows out a bit, some oranges & cream starts to come out of the beer a bit more, as well as some mild lemon about mid-drink.

Finally getting around to reviewing one of my all time favorites. Just had a 2 week old bottle and it did was even better than I remembered. I love that 3F now includes bottle dates on their beers. One of the best around!

Poured a bomber between 2 people. Lovely IPA aroma that pours with a full head. Has the classic Three Floyd's taste from their hops. One of my favorite Three Floyd's beers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared 22 oz bomber. Pours a dark golden clear liquid with a fairly large frothy white head. Loads of exotic fruits in the nose, peaches, pineapple, orange peel, grapefruit. Taste is refreshing at first with exotic fruits, finishes fairly bitter. Nice balance between the sweetness, hoppyness and the bitterness.
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 A mild Citrus and pine aroma, this is very good, but I was hoping for a little more...

Everything I hoped it would be and more. Had a terrible accident where I dropped the one bottle my friend brought me from Chicago, but he was nice enough to share the one he bought for himself. Smoothest imperial IPA I have ever had. The perfect appearance, great aroma, and just a wonderful finish. Can't rate this beer much higher!

Nice hazy orange color. Big white fluffy head. Very pretty looking. Not much hop aroma. Mostly an earthy smell. Pretty different smell compared to other doubles Ive had. Flavor is bitter at first, earthy, then hoppy. Some caramel flavors. Very well balanced beer. Im more of a hop forward type of person, but this one is still great. Similar in style to 90 minute, but way better. Easily most balanced imperial IPA Ive had.

On tap at the three Floyd's brewpub. Pours a light clear amber. Really crisp on the nose, with hop notes. Beautifully bitter, balancing a smooth flavor. Well done

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at three Floyds brewpub. Pours dark golden / amber with quick dissipating head. Aroma is very hoppy / piney. Smells slightly of citrus as well. Taste is dangerously smooth. No alcohol burn for a beer of this ABV. Very hoppy, but with a strong sweet malt backbone. Somewhat oily. Well carbonated and smooth on the palate. Very good, if not perfect Double IPA.

Not overly bitter and very smooth. Citrus and pine are very noticeable. Nice color. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Three floyds doesnt care about bottle date, so neither to I!

A: apricot ale with less than single finger of egg whites. This dissipates quickly to a broken sheet of the same. Ring lace. Excellent clarity. 

S: biscuit malt, some citric hops. Hints of pine sol. Meh. 

T: soooo, this beer quite sweet. Like honey and biscuits. Hints of pine. Not much else. 

M: medium bodied and moderately hi carb. 

O: Im gonna guess this is old, but hard to tell. Until Ive had a confirmed fresh beer, I have to say this beer is average.

Serving type: bottle

08-12-2011

Bottle, thanks to drfabulous for filling in a big want on my quest to cover the top 50. Pours clear amber with lovely, luxurious, creamy white frothy head. No real lacing. Aroma is ... Mostly caramel? Some pine, some peppermint, somewhat floral, a bit of onion. If I strain maybe I can imagine smelling some citrus, but its probably in my head. Doesnt match up with the description as Id hoped. Anyway ... Taste: sweet caramel malty up front, plenty of bitterness that lasts and lasts and lasts. Alcohol makes itself felt as well. Palate: full body, oily slick texture, good carbonation. Overall: there must be some pretty serious batch-to-batch variation in this, or its changed, or times have changed, or something. I dont think its ridiculously old or anything, either. Were I to have this at a bar from an unnamed brewery I wouldnt take any special notice.
On tap at Sugar Maple. Pours hazy gold. Some wheat flavor. Not as much hop sting as I was anticipating, but a great flavor profile of flower petals, spruce, mango, and apricot.

Hazy amber pour with a white head. Aromas of citrus peel, mango, and pineapple with floral hop aromas too. The nose on this one is really awesome. Flavor doesnt disappoint either! Nice malt balance to the hops with the floral/citrus notes coming out nicely as it warms up just a bit. Smooth finish with a slight bitter hop note. Great beer.
Draft. Nice citrus aroma with a distinctive malt aroma as well. Medium mouthfeel, with a resiny, mouth coating body. Malt backbone makes this a bit filling, and takes away from hop blast.

A delicious beer that is an overall winner in every catagory for a DIPA. Aroma is hoppy with mango over tones and an underlying dankness that I personally love. Appearance is beautiful light orange, and mouthfeel is dense but still lighter than most beers of this style, making it dangerously drinkable. Taste is maltier and not quite as aggressive as 3Fs other featured DIPA, Arctic Panzer Wolf, but still packs an awesome punch. In 2013, this isnt nessecarily a super-unique beer, but its does everything right.
Citrus, pine and mango in the aroma. Cloudy light amber color with nice head. Bitter citrus, pine and onion taste. Perfect mouthfeel. Bitter aftertaste liners more than it should.
Very sweet bear. Lots of foam. Very present carbonation and alcohol taste. Nice, balanced, rich sweetness. Also bitter touches of hop. Great beer.

22 oz. bottle in trade from Fletche00. Nice orange color, with a medium, beige head. The lacing is thick and persistent. The aroma is mangoes, sweet potatoes, caramel, pine, and a lot of herbs. Intense bitterness, cut with a mild, grainy sweetness. Heavy body, sticky, thick, acidic, with a harsh, metallic mouthfeel. The finish is sticky and bitter, and very persistent. Overall, this is an immense, flavorful DIPA. The mouthfeel and aftertaste are very overpowering, and not very pleasant. Still, this a delicious, irresistible, and great tasting beer.

22oz bottle pours semi-clear amber with nice finger of head. Got this one fresh. Nose is big fruity hops, orange, pineapple, lemon, citrus. Taste is tons of tropical fruit, pineapple, mango, citrus, with a very nicely balanced malt presence that holds up the hops well. Finish is bitter juicy grapefruit and pine resin, a touch of heat as it warms, lasts. Amazing DIPA.

Bottle. Pours a copper orange color with white head. Resiny, grassy, hoppy, piney aromas. Hoppy, resiny, grassy, earthy, piney flavors. Very hoppy and you can taste the alcohol a little. Really hoppy beer, quite good. Not quite 100 Percentile in my mind, but I wouldnt mind having a few of these.
Light hazy gold with white head. Aroma is perfect. Pine, grapefruit and a little fleshy fruit. Taste is hoppy. Great citrus front with bitter back. Love it.

Bottle poured into a tulip. Amber color with light head. Aroma of mango, peach, citrus and pine. Taste is mango and light caramel malt with a good hop profile. Finish is a bit too much pepper. Overall a great beer.
Bottle via trade. Pours a medium amber-orange, little head. Aroma biscuit malt, resin, maybe some booze. Really nice in the nose. Body lively, effervescent, finish slightly sweet, well-balanced.
UPDATED: NOV 16, 2013 Bottle. Hazy golden yellow pour with frothy head. Nice citrus malt aroma. Sweet malt and slight citrus flavor. Clean, balanced, easy drinker (9.5% well hidden).

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 Bottle from chalet party shop. Pours clear amber with a large white head. The aroma is peppery, earthy, mango, pineapple, peach. The taste is very bitter, has a bit of grapefruit balance, resiny dry bitter finish. As it warms, more lemon and pineapple come through.

Pours hazy copper with big frothy white head. Aroma is very nice pine, citrus and floral. This is some serious hop juice. Some pine and lots of citrus. Really great hop profile, some pine and lots of citrus that gives flavors of mango and other tropical fruit and grapefruit. Big caramel malt back bone balances the big hop flavor perfectly. Medium body but very crisp and easy to drink especially considering the high ABV and it has the perfect level of carbonation. This is an amazing beer. Maybe the perfect IPA.
Pours a golden yellow. Citrus on the nose. Minimal head that fades quickly. Crisp and clean. Very nice flavor. Finishes dry. Great beer.
Bottle. Pour is golden Orange, fluffy white head. Aroma is mango, tropical, citrus, malt. Tate is mango and grapefruit forward, grain and light roasted malt, balanced and tasty.

A: Hazy Orange Hue, Passes Mild Light, Thick Off White Head, Great Lacing

S: Oranges, Grapefruit, Grainy, Sweet Malts

T: Grapefruit, Sweet Malts, Piney, Pineapple

M: Great Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Dry, Mildly Bitter

Overall, a solid DIPA that doesnt burn you out, very well balanced, and is very easy drinking for a 9.5 ABV, almost no boozy taste at all.

As soon as I drank this I thought it was a beefed up Zombie Dust with a bit of Aloha King with some extra malt. Totally 3Floyds. I think this is a really good beer. I do disagree with the label that says "a hopheads dream." It isn't as hoppy as I'd have guessed from reading that. But it is well balanced. I'd say it is a bit syrupy. I prefer a little more dry but it is an Imperial IPA, so it's expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear orange yellow, off white head. Aroma is pretty light but pine and citrus. Clean pine and citrus taste. Light and clean.

Had on-tap at Kumas Corner in Chicago. $10 for a pint.

Appearance: A very cloudy yellow color with two fingers worth of a fairly creamy head. Lacing is here-and-there, but overall, it looks excellent in the glass.

Smell: Hm. Not bad at ALL, but not as fantastic as I was expecting, given other reviews. The peach/guava/tropical fruit are definitely there, but not in as big of a way that I wanted.

Taste/feel: Man... I love the assertive bitterness of this beer. I really, really do. The same fruit in the aroma comes in the beginning of each sip and offers the taste buds a lot of sweetness. The taste of Dreadnaught is what I wanted in the aroma, if you get me. Next is a split second of grassy/piney sorts of hops before finally just going away, leaving a lingering bitterness and warmth at the back of the throat that makes you desperately want another sip to wash that slight warmth/burn away... but then it comes back. So you sip again. And again. And again... Keep in mind that I find that to be a good thing. Thats not a con.

My score may not really show it, but I was slightly disappointed with Dreadnaught, despite the fact that I still liked it. A lot. Id be curious to see what this tastes like out of a bottle to compare. This beer is worth your time.
Bottle pour a few weeks back. This might be my favorite DIPA of all time. An amazing hop character that has just the right amount of Carmel sweetness. Amazing.

Poured into a pint glass out of a 22oz bomber.

Pours a nearly clear medium gold with a thick one finger white head. Awesome head retention and really good lacing left on the sides of the glass.

Great hop aroma full of tropical fruit. Orange and mango along with some pineapple and tangerine. No malt at all with hops providing all of the aroma. Truly outstanding.

This hop dominance carries over into the taste. A huge rush of juicy tropical citrus that never really goes away. Orange and tangerine along with a touch of pineapple. A very light touch of bread in the background from the malt but it remains restrained and allows the hops to shine. A moderate bitterness and a slight warming in the back of the throat from the alcohol. Finish a pretty crisp and dry considering the abv.

Overall, what an amazing IIPA. The drinkability on this is incredible. I had no idea what the abv was before seeing it on here and guessed it was around 7.5% Thats how well it is hidden. Truly a beer to pick up should you come across it.

Great citrus aroma. Thick head and a hoppy tastes that's top notch. One of the best imperial IPA's I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is citrus, pine, malts, fruit and very fresh/clean hops. The flavor is citrus, tropical fruit/pineapple, biscuit/mildly sweet malts, grapefruit, mild pulp texture and a bitter/tangy/mildly dry finish.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Amber/Copper color head is beautiful and thins out and sticks to the glass.

Smells strongly of pine, resin and grapefruit. 

Taste of bitter hops, pine, citrus, orange, grapefruit. The alcohol is masked perfectly. Smooth lingering aftertaste that makes your mouth water for another sip. 

Medium body and sticky mouthfeel and average carbonation.

220z/650ml bottle in a Snifter. Pours a clear copper/orange with a half finger, off-white head that thins to a film and ring that marks the glass nicely.
Aroma is strong with notes of pine, resin, citrus, fruit, and hints of bread and alcohol. More aromatic as it warms.
Taste is bitter with a warm, pine, slight citrus, bread aftertaste. Doesnt taste like 9.5%
Medium body with a low-medium carbonation. Smooth in the mouth with a touch of resin on the texture. Just the right amount of bubbles to keep it moving. Very nice.
Overall very nice. A big bitter but balanced well. Solid mouth feel and aroma. Alcohol is well blended in and not over-powering. Im glad I have another bottle! Will buy again for sure next time Im in Indy.

Thanks to tderoeck for sharing at RBBSGII! 

Golden amber - a pretty ale. Course cream colored head.
Smell is of grapefruit, citrus, caramel and some pine.
Taste - grapefruit and caramel to start with a tropical fruit aftertaste ending dry and crisp.
Medium body, it does go down nicely!

Draught at the Three Floyds Brewpub, Munster, IN.
Clear deep amber colour with an average sized foamy off-white head.
Fresh hoppy aroma with fruits, pine and mild resin. Some balancing biscuity sweet maltiness. Balanced!
Probably one of the most balanced IPA/DIPAs in the world. Strong hoppy flavour with bitterness and mild balancing malty sweetness. No alcohol flavour but warming feeling near my liver. Or kidney... It also might be something else... like my 30-day holiday... But anyway the alcohol is craftily hidden. Super balanced and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a semi-hazy apricot color with a foamy white head that lingers. Definite hop and citrus aroma, fruity. Sharp taste, boozy. Surprisingly strong malt finish. Great beverage

Aroma is 60/40 pine to citrus. Vivid and resinous with spruce and orange with peach. Appearance is amber honey colored with a tan head. Taste is bitter clean and crisply bitter. Easy to drink. Grapefruit rind and peach. Real deal perfect for style.

22oz bottle Old Notes-Pours an orangish amber with a decent sized white head. Aroma of citrus, hops, and malt. Taste of hops and more hops. This full bodied brew is a kick ass double IPA. Well balanced and quite tasty.

Sweet aroma... Hops at the end. Tastes of strong hops yet sweet. Multiple flavors yet well balanced. Overall it's very enjoyable beer, if money wasn't an issue I would buy much more of it ;). Among my tops!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Since my brother is the hop head, I have to try all of his stuff. This literally punched me in the face. Very bitter, very intense hop attack. Not my stuff, but if youre a hop nut, this is as good as it gets.

Hazy, bright orange/gold with a large, rocky off-white head. The aroma is mildly fruity with citrus and faint grass. It has a full body with slick texture and lively carbonation. The taste is bittersweet with a long bitter finish.

Dark golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, malts, yeast, candy, citrus and other tropical fruits. Hoppy flavour, quite a lot of hops and hop oils. Light sweet, malts, light honey. Bitter finish, hops, malts, some honey. Nice IIPA.
(from 66cL bottle @ RBBSG II, Gent 2013. Thanks for sharing, Tim!)

Got a bomber in Indiana. Amazing imperial, with some solid fruit tones and no alcohol flavor. Looks great too

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

10/VIII/13 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBSG II, my place - bottled: IV/2013 or 13/IV/2013, who knows... (2013-723) Thanks to BelvidereIPA for the trade!
Clear orange beer, big bubbly irregular off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. aroma: lots of citrus, pineapple, bit sweet, honey, mango, fruity. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: citrus, bit piny, honey, sweet touch, passion fruits, nice hopiness. Aftertaste: lots of citrus, bit sweet, honey, malty, piny hops, very nice!

Undated 22 oz. bomber purchased earlier this month in Ohio. 

A role model for appearance: Deep amber color with ample fine-grained carbonation rising to an off-white, creamy head. The head is perfectly proportioned and very durable. Picture perfect lacing is left on the glass. 

S: Only moderately aromatic for style, with sweet malts and fruity hops nearly in balance. Citrus rind dominates but there is a slight floral element too. 

T: Malty, but with the hops clearly dominant. Orange, grapefruit some vague tropical fruit and a just a hint of pine. Nice long aftertaste with mild bitterness. 

M: Smooth with soft carbonation. Really excellent for a 9.5% ABV DIPA. Medium-full-bodied.

O: World-class DIPA. Id love to taste this along with Hopslam and some other greats, but 3F is unavailable here in SC.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Aroma is citrus, appearance is dark amber, taste is hoppy and a little fruity, overall good iipa

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Bottle: Murky amber and copper, so hazy and cloudy that it blocks all light. Foamy, soapy eggshell head. Aroma is perfume and floral hops, light tropical fruits and some sweet caramel malt. Taste starts with a strong malty caramel base thats pretty sweet. Hops come in quick, pungent, floral, and strong like perfume. Heavy bitterness fades into finish with more buttery malt sweetness. Pretty thick and sticky mouth feel with rolling carbonation. Not my favorite, too sweet and too much caramel malt. Decent at best... very overrated in my opinion.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 Had to rate this now after drink so many other double iPas. Notes of grapefruit, hoops and booze in this one.  Leaves a grapefruioty hoppy bite.  The citrus really hides the booze in this one.      Had to drop my rating.  Three Floyd's has become over hyped on my opinion.   So many better don't blue IPAs

Bottle.
Appearance: Hazy amber to orange bodied, thin light tan head.
Aroma: Orange juice and light floral notes.
Taste: Moderately bitter, lots of orange juice presence. Very one-note.
Palate: Medium bodied, moderately bitter.
Overall: Pretty good, but very simple. No layered hop complexity, just a straight forward citrus IIPA.

På mikkeller & friends. Först tog den slut i shopen någon timme före vi hinner dit och vi börjar grina. MEN då visar det sig att den finns i baren! Doftar maltsötma. Mycket härlig smak. Väldigt maltig. Datum? Framgår ej och kapsylen är kastad. Men troligen är den färsk då den levereras direkt utan mellanhänder och dom fick den för några dagar sedan. Kul att vi fick tag på den tillslut. Pröjsade ca 200 danska

#2450. Courtesy of tderoeck. Thx! 650 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBSG II. Bottled during 04/2013. Bright orange with a white head. Nose is sweet grapefruit, passion fruit, touch exotic fruits, light malt backbone & slightly starting to fade. Taste is bitter grapefruit, very dry, spices, bitter citrus, herbs, light sweet malts, quite heavily bitter. Substantial body. Solid IIPA, I enjoyed it but I dont really get the hype. The profile is not unique, just standard USA IIPA and it is not the best made example I have had.

Poured from a bomber into a tulip glass. Aromas of peach and citrusy hops. Pours a golden-amber, with a fluffy white head. Flavors of caramel and citrusy hops. For as hoppy as this beer is, its very well-balanced. Damn, this is good.

Pours out of the 22 oz bomber a cloudy golden orange with a thick, three finger eggshell colored head. Nice retention with soapy lacing throughout my Spiegelau IPA glass. The aroma is heavy on hops - lots of citrus, hint of pine, with some grassy/floral notes. in addition to the wonderful hop aromas, one can also detect sweet malt and some biscuity notes. On the front of the tongue there's sweet citrus, toffee, and bread. Dreadnaught finishes with nice bitterness with hints of tropical fruit, rose, grass and sweet malts. Full bodies with a thick mouthfeel and effervescent carbonation. Overall, if this isn't the best DIPA on the market, it's pretty close. Another homerun FFF. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled from bottle @ RBBSG II. One of my big time wants thanks to tderoeck. Huge thanks Tim! Clear orange color, small to medium sized white to off - white head. Smell malts, oranges, lightly grapefruit and hops. Taste malts, hops, moderately grapefruit, medium to heavy bitter. Long lingering bitterness in the finish with a touch of fruityness. Medium to full body and carbonation. Well, its a very nice beer, but (maybe because of huge expectations) its not the gigantic 4+ I had hoped it would be. Still, I would drink this everyday if I had the chance.
On tap at FFF poured into nonic pint. Peach and pine aroma with a hint of vanilla. Good hoppy finish. Very good!

Pours a nice golden amber color with a frothy white head that lasts an average while and leaves great lacing. Aroma is fruit, citrus and sweet mostly with some pine notes. Flavor is bittersweet but still smooth with citrus and pine notes. Finish is minimal but a little bitter. Mouth feel is astringent carbonation is average. I love the aroma but the flavor does not seem to match its complexity.
Clear amber pour with a huge white head. Big fruit, citrus, and hoppy aroma. Supremely smooth, and the high abv is well hidden. One of the best, if not the best.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stefansgade
Orange hazy, white head. Smells of citrus, zests and pine. Quite fruity aromas, plenty of hops in here. Medium sweet, quite clean, heavy hopped bitter finish with nice resins and pine. A very nice double IPA. You cant tell this is 9,5%, its so insanly easy drinkable

Tap @ mikkeller stefansgade, 5/8 2013. Dark clear orange, small white head, great lacing that last. Aroma, hops and lots of it, citrus, mango, fruity, malty background, .Taste, sweet hoppyness that turns bitter, fruity, mango/peach, citrus, caramel malt, . Long bitter aftertaste. Great ipa, the aroma is amazing.

Color of clear gold. Whitish head. Aroma of mangoes, apricots, and tropical fruit. Taste is very hoppy like the smell but has a good caramel backbone to keep it from getting too bitter. Medium body, there is a crispness, alcohol in the finish. Very good, tropical and fruity iipa.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great color, aroma and flavor. Just a top-notch IPA. If you like Imperial IPAs, you owe it to yourself to find this beer.

Beautiful gold color, tall white head, lots of citrus and mango on the nose, well balanced with solid malt backbone ... Spectacular...!!!

---Rat via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour copper yellow. Nose awesome mango, citrus, pine, and sweet hop with a hint olf cat. Taste similar, huge aromatic and flavoing hop. Midpalate sweetness and a syrupy mouthfeel. Balanced bitter finish. Fantastic example of DIPA, my new favorite beer.

This is an outstanding beer. Higher alcohol, but you wouldn't know it by the taste. Velvety on palette, and a pleasure to drink. I'll buy every time. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

660 ml bottle shared with close family. Pours deep yellow to orange golden with a steady creamy head. Aroma is full of exotic fruits, pineapple in the front (mix of slight fruity sourness and funky fruitiness). Incredible soft palate, nice bitterness and slight sweetness. A bit better than the edgy than the Wolf. Damn... why. make. dark. lord. when. you. are. so. much. better. at. making. IP. As!!!!!!

22 ounce bottle into signature tulip glass, no bottle dating. Pours lightly hazy bright orange amber color with a 1-2 finger dense off white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big tangerine, orange zest, lemon zest, peach, pineapple, floral, grass, light caramel, light pine, and floral earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of hop notes with a moderate malt balance; and great strength. Taste of tangerine, orange zest, lemon zest, pineapple, peach, floral, grass, light pine, light caramel, and floral earthiness. Light floral/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of big tangerine, orange zest, orange rind, lemon zest, pineapple, peach, floral, grass, pine, and floral earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic balance and complexity of citrus/tropical hops flavors with a light-moderate malt balance; and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a smooth, slick, and moderately sticky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warning noticed after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic DIPA! Fantastic complexity and balance of citrus and tropical hop flavors with a moderate malt balance; and very smooth and fairy crisp to sip on for the gravity. A highly enjoyable offering.

Beautiful deep golden color with thick bubbly white head. Aroma is piny citrus hops. Taste is dank pine and juicy grapefruit citrus upfront with caramel maltiness on the follow through. Aftertaste is lingering bitter citrus and dank resinous pine. Palate is sticky. Overall this is an outstanding Imperial IPA. Heavy juicy hop bomb with good malty backbone.

Pros: this beer rocks! The taste is kinda bitter. However, the booze in this beer will have you "feelin it". 

I do not recommend more than 2 pint glasses of this beer.

Cons: the price $10.99 for a 22 oz is kinda steep

I enjoy this beer exclusively at the horseshoe casino. If you're lucky the barkeep will mistakenly serve this to you in a pint glass and you will have a really good time.

I recommend apocypalyse cow over this beer

I have much respect for this beer though

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 22oz. Thx Thaumeh
Pours hazy golden with medium beige head. Intense lacing. Aroma is of pine, fruits, malt, resin, sligth alcohol. Taste is of pine, fruits (tropical), malt, alcohol, grapefruits. Palate: Medium body. Nice carb. Quite impressive balance. Overall: Very nice beer. Intense fruits. Malt is not overdone. Refreshing.

Excellent citrus aroma. Apperance is golden brown with nice lacing. Enjoyable taste with hints of peach and mango. I continue to be a fan of all the 
Three Floyds brews I have consumed.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2013 I drank this from a 22oz bottle poured into a shaker glass. The aroma is resiny and alcoholic. The scent is not that hoppy. The taste is smooth and not as hoppy as I expected, but the the malts and hops are balanced very well. 

I tried this again on tap and it had a much hoppy aroma and flavor. I enjoyed it quite a lot

bottle shared by tom10101 - post-THE festival. hazy golden with a creamy white head, excellent retention and lacing. toastiness and caramel - tons of malt in there, candy floss, citrus and tropical notes. average carbonation, medium body - kind of heavy stuff, nice medium long citrusy-grapefruity finish. good but not the best out there..

From a 22oz bomber. Pours a clear amber/orange with a white head, great lacing. Aromas of citrus, mango, and hops. Taste of citrus, mango, and lots of hops, balanced out by sweet caramel malts. Amazing DIPA, probably my favorite from FFF.

Medium offwhite head, finger deep. Aroma of pineapple, apricot, citrus. Taste of tropical fruits, pine, alcohol, on a caramel backbone. Medium body, not too sweet, nice bite and very balanced, extremely drinkable
I really enjoy the mango notes. One of favorite DIPAs. I just wish I didnt have to drive from Michigan to Ohio to buy it.

I have only had this beer once and it was on draft. I am a big fan of 3 floyds they do not have many beers that let me down. Like I said only one time have I had this beer so dont think I gave it a low rating because I did not like it I actually greatly enjoyed it.

Ive had this countless times, from bottle and draft. This is from a freshish bomber. Beautiful, citrus bouquet of sweet malt and hop insanity. Im not the biggest fan of the owners but they can make some badass hoppy beer. Smells like centennial hops up front and an almost caramel malt back end to the aroma. The appearance is of a clear light amber with a solid two finger head that leaves lots of lacing on the glass. The bite is very smooth and just strong enough to battle off the sweet malt bill. The carbonation is spot on as usual and the finish nice and dry. Overall this is pretty much worthy of the score it has, its hard to touch what is king dipa around these parts.
great ipa, big citrus and pine nose. Flavor follows suit and adds great stone friut undertones. Long bitter finish with just enough malt

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2013 Pours a nice light orange. Grapefruit Caramel aroma. drinks super smooth. The bite is very subtle while not becoming too sweet as many do. tastes of piny toffee. Slight oil body with mid carbonation.

Thanks to my dad for schlepping this back from Indiana for me.  I thought this was a damn good beer, but I am not sure it matches up to the very best out there.  Pours a beautifully clear amber with a white head and excellent lacing.  Scent is of sweaty, earthy, with a touch of grapefruit.  Excellent hop bite, but the malt back end is slightly lacking.  Excellent carbonation.  Bottle - Liquor Locker - Evansville, IN
UPDATED: JUN 16, 2013 Bottle from chase! Pours medium yellow with nice head. Aroma is citrusy sweet hops. Taste is medium sweet and well balanced, great brew

Up front nose of apricot jam, mango, peach, jam, just wonderful. 
Golden color with a nice white froth.
Medium body. Smooth.
A little bitter aftertaste.
Really a treat!
Finally got to try this one after a co-worker brought me a bottle back from Indiana.  Sweet hop aroma and bitterness - top 10 DIPA, but just barely.

A - Super clear amber body with 2 fingers of moundy eggshell cream. The head slowly sinks into a thin cap with nice lacing patterns.

S - Loads of juicy stone and tropical fruits. Apricots, peaches, lychee, mango, papaya, candied citrus, pine, doughy sweet bread.

T - Just an onslaught of tropical and stone fruit. Papaya, peach, and lychee seem to dominate. Candied citrus, mango. A soft caramel malt backbone marries perfectly with the hops. Green pine seems to grab onto the edges of the tongue creating a slow build of bitterness that carries through the finish. The finish is more pine/grapefruit forward and dries out nicely.

M - Thick dense body, low to medium creamy carbonation. Dry finish.

Juicy would be one word to describe this beer. A very complex mix of aromas. Dreadnaught seems to be more dedicated to the aroma and flavoring hops while still providing an impressive bitter finish. This reminds me of a hoppier Maharaja. Wish I would have picked up more.

Serving type: bottle

09-14-2012
Bottle from Three Floyds. Poured slightly hazy clear orange to thick white head. Pleasant resin grapefruit aroma. Very smooth not bitter hop citrus flavor. Doesnt blow me away with is nice.

Moderately hazy Orange-Golden Color with a moderate amount of carbonation and a high amount of lacing along the sides. Nose has a very rich aroma of Peach, Oranges, Apricot and Malts. Flavor is a sweet blend of peaches, citrus hops, caramel, toffee and yeasts. Aftertaste is a combo of bitter piney resin and mango sweetness. Body is very heavy and the carbonation is fairly mild and adds to the flavor. Overall, one of the sweetest and best Imperial IPAs Ive had in a long time.
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2013 The resiny glory is anchored by heft from alcohol and swims in malt complexity.  There are pleasant herbal notes and plenty of aroma.
Bottle @ home. Pours orange with a large head. Smells piney, citrus and sweet. Big malty backbone and lots of citrus. Holy shit this is amazing.

Amber pour with a nice white head. Big citrus nose. Lots of fun hops here without a ton of bitterness. Very heavy on the citrus / grapefruit in the finish. Not my favorite DIPA, but a very good one for sure!
Good clean ipa. Poured clear orange yellow, off white head. Aroma is lacking but the taste is there. Clean pine and citrus and light body for an imperial. Very good.

Pour is orangish copper with a thin white head. Nose is hoppy with tropical notes of pineapple, citrus, flowers and pine. Taste is wonderfully balanced. Malt sweetness is there to tame the hop bitter and vice verse. Tastes f mango, citrus and floral bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium and not as oily as some other beers in this style. All in all a great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I love this beer.  Really delicious.  By far my favorite DIPA.  Better than either Pliney IMO.
On draught at Apex. Golden dark color. Fruity citrus aroma. Caramel, citrus, tropical fruit, hoppy bitterness in the taste. Nice bitter bite on the finish.

22 oz. bomber poured into a tulip glass. BIG thanks to joromiller for hooking me up straight from DLD 2013! Ive got to say, Ive been excited to get my hands on this behemoth DIPA for a long time! Pours a dark, hazy orange color with a thick, white, creamy head. Aroma is bursting with floral notes and resiny, piney hops. Flavor is grapefruit right up front on a nice, sweet caramel malt backbone. The finish has an elegant hop bitterness to it; not overpowering at all. The hop flavors really coat your tongue and leave a nice, lasting aftertaste. Texture is medium bodied & velvety smooth all the way down, with good carbonation. Overall, this brew is beyond amazing! Definitely right up there with Pliny and Hopslam for me. Great example of a DIPA. If you can get your hands on this, do it. Then send me some more. Please!

Huge piney citrus aroma. Color is orange and similar to most dipas. Feel like I have had a lot of good dipas lately and  trying to sort through what makes each unique. This has a huge hop presence but extremely drinkable. a liitl oily however. Would have to have back to back with some of the other good one to truly be able to see rate but sure enough this is up there with the best. Only thing for me is that it lacks a little malt in the body to keep it a little better balanced.  More i drank (22oz) I became a little less impressed.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2013 On tap at Apex for Gigantic Beer Week. 

A: Clear copper color with bubbles drifting throughout. A thin ring of white head. 

N: Dried leaves, pine, damp moss. Biscuit and a hint of pineapple. Not very strong, and not really all that appetizing.

T: Really, really sweet. More of that damp grass. Pretty sweet and then astringent. Where are the hops? 

M: Oily and heavy. Lots of alcohol. Needs a lot of work.

O: Really unimpressive. Not wholly undrinkable, but Ive given this beer three chances now, and its been a complete let down every single time. Pass.
Zeebra Extreme Beer Festival - Clear, dark blond. Aroma of caramelised tropical fruit. Quite sticky and sweet. Flavour is overly bittersweet. It doesnt drink so well.

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Poured a hazy medium amber with a thin white head and lots of broken lace. The aroma is rich and hoppy. A sign of things to come. The flavour is strong bitter, rich and hoppy too. There is some liqourice bitterness,but what makes this such a great beer is that the the bitterness does not dominate and the palate is super smooth. A classic for sure which does deserve its rating.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 Tap. Clear copper with a medium sized good lasting and lacing head. Aroma is mango, peach, light sweet citrus, white bread, rich caramel. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Delicious big chewy iipa that isnt over the top, but tastes of more, more, more.

On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours amber with and off white head. Lovely aroma of citrus & tropical fruits. Lovely sirupiness with coats the tongue without being closing. Gentle bitterness in the finish

@ Zeebra Extreme beer festival
Aromas of pine, mango
Bitter taste with a hint of alcohol.
Very nice beer.
Orange, white head. Nose is overripe mango, other sticky tropical fruits. Taste is overripe mango, tropical fruits, light stone fruits, good malt balance. Smooth, oily mouthfeel.

Draft at Mikkeller Bar. Orange  amber with an ok white head. Fruity, spicy aroma of hops, abricot and malty caramel. Flavor is malty but not exactly sweet, leading to a very  bitter finish. Some woody, herbal notes in the finish quite dry, alcohol easily felt.

Pours a medium amber in color. Nose is peaches, caramel, mango and apricot. Mouth is chock full of flavors: apricot, ripe sweet apples, mango, resin all blending together in sweet harmony. Aftertaste is tropical fruits on the verge of overripeness and hop bitterness.

Pours amber with low white head
Exploding hoppyness loaded with citusy and tropical fruits, caramel malts
Taste? Well it is loaded with apricots, peach, resin
Palate is creamy, full bodied, medium to high bitterness. Absolutely perfect well balanced

On tap. Pours light cloudy orange amber with low white head. Aroma of resin, butterscotch, caramel malt, mango, dried apricot, light citrus. Taste is a very balanced toffee sweet that quickly turns into a rich bitter with a massive long bitter finish. Medium, slightly oily body with soft carbonation.

Pours a glowing dark color, like clean oil. Smells of floral hops up front balanced by malt. Tastes like it smells with long legs and sweet finish. Well balanced for a big beer. Nice summer sipper.
Had in a flight at their bar. It had a thick head and a murky yellow color. Smells like fruity citrus hops. Tastes bitter with more citrus hops. Very good.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2014 Had in a flight  at three floyds brewpub. Pours rich yellow with thick foamy head. Smells like a line tree covered in brown sugar. Tastes like hops and a small amount of caramel and sweet fruits. This is a great great beer.

Had this a few times, but just rating now thanks to a fresh bottle through trade.  Amber pour, 1 thumbs worth of head.  Foral hop aroma, delicious! grapefruit, orange, pine, caramel malt to balance it out.  Medium body.  Really, youve had this before and you loved it.

Was able to fetch a fresh one of these at the store but no date code of course. Pours out a deep orange with lots of lacing. Smells like tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit, lemon and pine. The taste is a full on hop assault lots of tangerine, lemon zest, tons of grapefruit, some hard candy and pine. Definitely one of the more aggressively hopped DIPAs in recent memory. Palate is rich and full. Overall a very hoppy beer that should feed anyone's hop fix.

Unclear Dark orange amber. Large (lasting), thick, frothy, creamy white head. Creamy foam mustache. Juicy and aromatic: sweet, fruity, citrus, peach, mango (just as advertised). Medium body. Would definitely consider this hop candy. Surprisingly drinkable!

aroma-citrus, hoppy, light spices.  fruit. sweeter than the average IPA.  
Tastes, very hoppy, but not very bitter.  Bitter is subdubed by something...fruit.  Very interesting, it is like fruit overlacing hops. The smoothest and hoppest beer I think Ive ever had.

Pours orange 
Smaller than standard , yet nice foam 

Smell is not THAT intence , but i do get some nice fruityness 
Supersmooth carbo ! 
Superfruity taste , mango , some parts citrus , realy juicy ! Not that bitter , its very nice ! As far as i know , this is fresh .. 

Its one out of my top 5 iipas for sure , yet not a new no 1

Pours a clear copper from the bottle with pillowy off-white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of citrus, peach, mango, and a slight pale caramel malt back. Taste follows, good tropical notes from the hops, and a nice bitter spicy finish. Really easy to drink for the abv, and the flavors and smells really come out nicely as it warms. Damn good, thanks joromiller!

UPDATED: APR 23, 2014 Served-Tap,bottle, and cask. Cask will always be my favorite. Very fruity but the complexity of the malts and hops stand out. Strong hop finish. Readily available from my location.
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2014 Bottle from john. Pours copper with white head. Taste is overly malty with bitter finish.

Bottle, thnx to budznudz, cheers Chris! This pours a cloudy bright orange beer with a small, one finger white head on top. Beautiful lacing on the glass and the head settles slowly. Aroma is of fresh peach, pine and has little citric notes. Very well balanced between different hop varieties. Flavour is bitter with a very subtle alcoholic kick to it. Kind of sweet flavour in the middle and it has a long lasting, medium bitter aftertaste. Sugary, sticky mouthfeel. Great balance between hops and alcohol. Awesome brew!!

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2013 Pours a gorgeous clear copper golden color with a signature white head that is continuously fed by carbonation from the bottom. Amarillo hops dominate the bouquet. The hops in the flavor are perfectly balanced with the grain. This might be the perfect beer. Of course, you throw Amarillo on dog excrement and youre bound to have something that tastes at least passable.
Tasted from a 22oz. bomber. Bright hop aroma. Nice caramel taste, smooth and hoppy. A great tasting Imperial Pale Ale.

Poured it out of a 22 ounce bomber, it had a hazy golden color with a foamy head and nice lacing. It had a strong citrus / mango aroma. Very strong hop taste with a firm bitter finish (like my woman). Great Imperial IPA.

22oz bomber courtesy of budznsudz. Thanks Chris! Pours a hazy amber color with a nice white head and good lacing. Nice aromas of citrus, pine, malt, and spice. Taste is grapefruit, pine, malt, caramel, with a nice bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours a gorgeous cloudy orange with a filmy head. Aroma of dank pineapple, alfalfa, a touch of sawdust, a sweet hoppiness.  Grassy forward with sweet tropical fruit flavor and a nice bitter hoppy back. Sticky texture, bitter long finish. Nice imperial IPA, but not worthy of a top-50 rating.

Poured from a 22oz bomber into a HF taster. Pours a nice clear amber orange color with a small white head. Scents are muted... May be the age of the bottle. Taste is awesome... So smooth. Citrus and tropical fruitful... Nice bitterness. Clean finish.
Pours gold with a white head.  Piney, citrus hop aroma.  Flavor is piney, citrusy, resiny.  I love this beer.

Aroma of apricot with a big head and a dirty brown pour.  Taste of citrus and floral which lingers and warms the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a moderate frothy white head. Nose is extremely hoppy and fragrant with some floral and spruce elements to it. Taste is a tad bit bitter, but balanced extremely well. Remarkably light, too. Great beer.

3/1/2013. Pours a hazy green-gold with a thick white head. Aroma is pineapple, fruit, pine, citrus, spice. Taste is clean and crisp; pineapple, citrus, spice,earth, great bitter hops. Really nice lacing. Chewy mouth feel. This is an excellent DIPA. Incredibly flavorful; nice aromatics; chewy. Expertly crafted; well-worth drinking.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 400th rating! Thank you to manbrognig74 for the bottle. Poured from 22oz bottle into the tulip. Huge head forms and stays. Sort of hazy burnt orange color. Piney aroma with some grapefruit. Smells delicious. Thorough lacing down the sides of the glass. After a taste it is easy to see how this is one of the top IIPAs. Sweet front end and a crisp bitter back end. The bitterness is just enough to let you know it is there, similar to Heady. What a great beer for #400.

Pours a hazy, golden color with a finger and a half sized head.  I got aromas of mango, grapefruit, and other citrusy fruits, as well as a bit of butterscotch in the background.  I was impressed by how well balanced this beer was, because with the heavy bitterness comes this intence sweetness up front.  It feels like this beer sticks to the inside of your mouth.  I love this beer.

22oz bottle. Pours a hazy golden with a finger of head. Aroma has a lot of citrus with a hint of fruitiness. Flavor is intense. Very citrusy and fruity. A perfect balance between hops and malt. Flavor sits on your tongue for a bit and leaves a very sweet finish. The long search was worth it.
2012 bottle. A face slap of big hops. Citrusy and sticky with a surprisingly pleasant mouthfeel.

9oz snifter.   Pours slightly hazy golden color,  very small white head.    Great complex hop flavor, hides 100 IBU very well.   Smooth and easy to drink. Very light citrus quality.   Finishes a little dry,  but pleasant.
Great imperial ipa. Citrusy and bitter but both flavors counterbalance well to make a good refreshing beer.

Bottle from trade with skycracksopen, big thanks!
Pale amber with an off-white head leaving lacing.
Taste: over-ripe tropical fruits, pine, citrus fruits, very light rancid butter.
Taste: pineapple+peach juice, toffee, some pepper, sweet, orange, non-sour lemon, clementine, over-ripe fruit.
Medium bodied+, moussy.
Nice and juicy, but not top class due to something that didnt feel that fresh (over-rope fruits and butter), even if it was not disturbing. Ill drink it again any chance I get, so feel free to send me one.

22 oz bomber. Pours a gorgeous copper with great head and lacing. Aroma hits you in the face with citrus and mango. Taste is brilliant !!  Complex, well balanced. Dry crisp finish. Not your typical DIPA. 3 Floyd's is the real deal. Everyone raves about Stone's beers but 3 Floyd's kills em !!

----Hophaze out

Poured from a 22 oz bomber, light haze but clear and golden, deep golden. Good head and lacing. The aroma is wonderful, and you can smell it right away: citrus and mango. The flavor isnât what I expected from the smell. Immediate taste of hops, but them the burn from the alcohol. That was surprising. I expected it to be more smooth. Not sure about the aftertaste. Almost medicinal. This is good, but not among the top. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I thought it was a very good D/IPA but not as good as a few others Ive had recently.  Pours a nice cloudy copper orange with a frothy white head and lots of substantial lacing.  The bouquet is quite nice.  Peach, mango, citrus and lots of floral on the nose.  The citrus comes out on the taste but some of the other flavors in the aroma get muted.  Thats my only complaint.  Other than that its a great beer.

THE perfect IPA.  Most Imperials have a syrupy feel that drowns the hops.  Not this bad boy.  Its a beautiful dry bitter finish.   Theres a reason this one and Pliny the Elder always seem to dominate the top IPA rankings.  I think they are both very comparable in taste and quality.

Has a Great hoppy aroma, pungent and floral with a little booze.  With a frothy, off white head, it pours slightly cloudy and golden.  The aroma is amazing but the taste doesnt deliver what the smell promises.  There is something missing in the front, it takes a while for the flavor to resurge.  Its good but not perfect!
22 oz bomber pours gold with white head. Strong hop citrus aromas. Mango citrus orange and exotic fruit. A bit of tart hop taste as well.

Pours dark amber with little head. Aroma is huge citrusy hops. Brewery description really nails it. Mango, peach and citrus with a nice malty backbone. Lively carb backs up a nice rich mouthfeel.

Pours a clear light amber with a huge rocky white head.  Citrus, grass, mango, and earthy dank aromas.  Big hoppy flavor with malt, caramel, mango, grapefruit, orange peel, and pineapple notes.  Full bodies with a smooth mouthfeel.  Finishes with a lingering citrus aftertaste.

Have drank this one many times from both bottle and on tap. Very hoppy and delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 Pours a clear gold with good head and lacing.  Very nice mango and tropical hop aroma with some dankness.  Taste has tropical fruit with mango, citrus and dankness.  Good amount of bitterness. Big IPA with big flavors..  Moderate mouthfeel.   Zombie Dust is better.

Bottle to snifter.  Pours a hazy golden orange with foamy white head.  Smell is predominantly tropical fruits with only a light hops aroma.  Taste is piney bitter hops with tropical fruits with some brininess and yeast.  Not well balanced and not as good as the Zombie Dust.

22 ounce bottle.  Pours a cloudy honey color.  Small white head.  Some lacing.  Aroma of both pine and grapefruit.  Good body, about what youd expect from an imperial IPA.  Nice combo of bitterness with just enough caramel sweetness to offset.  Mildly sticky, but still very drinkable.  Very good, but in my opinion not quite up to expectations based on what I saw others post.  It is hop juice and I appreciate that, but while very good there wasnt a huge wow factor for me.  Maybe a fresh bottle/draft pour would change my mind.  Still, even though my comments are muted in comparison to others it is clear that this is another very good brew from Three Floyds.

Hazy orange pour with a slight bit of white head. Nice citrus smells, mango, orange, tangerine. A spicy carbonated hop bite that gives way to citrus and a salty bitter that intensifies. Intense but not that complex. Wasn't crazy about it. Preferred the zombie dust.

Fantastically crisp beer that is really quite smooth considering the 9.5% ABV, another (really) solid beer from 3F.
This beer is dangerous because despite its high IBU and ABV it is very easy drinking.  Goes down smooth and when finished you want another right away.  Fantastic 2XIPA.

Pours slightly cloudy golden orange color with a big pillowy head that fades slowly and never fully goes away.  Big citrus and tropical fruit aroma, pineapples, grapefruit, mangos, peaches.  Hints of flowers and caramel too.  Taste is a hop bomb, in a good way.  Big citrus and tropical fruit taste right at first and then a heavy bitterness takes over through the finish.  Somehow it still remains smooth.  Finish has a nice spiciness to it too.  Medium body and somewhat sticky mouthfeel.  This is a top notch DIPA but not up there as one of my favorites.

Bottle (bomber) from a trade with rfraga. Clear deep golden, medium white head. Strong piney and perfumy aroma with tropical fruits. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with a firm, lingering bitterness. Very nice.

Poured into half pint at brewery. Amber in color. Citrusy and hoppy in the nose. Nicley carbinated on the tongue. Hoppy with mild bitter finish. Nice hints of grape fruit. This is pretty much what an imperial ipa should be. Great to have anytime of the year and it is worth its high rating. Another 3F classic.
Not all grapefruit, its a nice change aroma-wise.  Beautiful pour, Taste is great, for a non-hophead.  Very smooth, fruity, malty, excellent flavor.  Second best IPA Ive ever tasted after Cigar City

Oh Lordy, the day has finally come for me to try this beast - Bomber courtesy of pellegjr, serious thanks to Joey for this! 
Pours a hazy orange/amber with medium sized long-lasting white head; plenty of lacing throughout. Aroma is a huge hit of citrus fruit with touches of apricot, orange, a (surprisingly delicate) note of pine resin, and a lick of sweet caramel malt. Taste brings all those wonderful citrus fruits together into a pithy grapefruit and orange attack with some lighter more tropical stuff happening further back on the palate. Caramel malt sweetness is so lightly done that it lets the wonderful hops do the talking whilst keeping a little bit of balance. The hop bitterness is intense but by no means overpowering; a cracking, mouth-covering grapefruit and pine bitterness lasts long into the aftertaste - this is bitter, as an IIPA bloody well should be!  Mouthfeel is medium/full with medium/heavy carb. Absolutely no hint of alcohol anywhere near this, brilliantly disguised. Finish is deliciously medium-dry. This is world class, no doubt about it, more or less lives up to the massive hype that surrounds it. Thanks again to Joey for giving me the opportunity to give this a go.

On tap at 3Floyds brewpub.  Ive had this several times but never got around to rating.  This is big hoppy and bitter.  Lots of juicy citrius hops that 3Floyds is famous for.  Some pine and cedar but mostly pineapple, apricot orange and grapefruit.  A touch of sweet malt balances it out.  This is the gold standard by which I judge all other Imperials.  Very very good double IPA.

golden orange pour, strong tropical fruit aromas, pineapple, mango, citrus, the taste is mango, orange, pineapple with a bitter sweet finish. I love this stuff, it drinks so well for a DIPA, its refreshing and balanced the alcohol is no where to be found. The rating here is well deserved and IMO this should be the prime example of what the style is.

Bottle from Bev 4 Less: Finally, I have wanted a bottle of this for years now, but just never bothered to set up a trade since trading is too expensive.  Created thick fluffy layer of foam head in the pour while the liquid was a golden blonde color with clouds of sediment. As for the aroma, the nose is bold with juicy citrus like hops that clearly dominate this Imperial IPA. The flavor was bitter yet semi sweet with an upfront taste of pine and assorted citrus fruits such as grapefruit, orange peel, and lemon zest all while holding a strong backbone of malts and yeast that hold this beer together.
This beer is super tasty for its alcohol content.  I recommended you try this one along with Gumbalhead.  3 Floyds is the best brewery in the world.

Pours a golden orange with a large white head and lots of lacing. Aroma of orange, peach, mango, and of course hops. Taste is hops and malts up front with citrus and hops. Palate is light to medium with a lighter creamy texture and decent carbonation. At over 9%, this is surprisingly crisp and refreshing with the alcohol hidden well. Very nice!
Pours an amberish orange with a medium white head. Bold, hoppy aroma.Fruity hop tast with a bit of caramel malt backbone. Bosy is good for the style. Really enjoyed this, but I was expecting more.

For the price and the ratings I was disappointed in my first 3 floyds beer. Light golden color with a small white head. Little amount of lacing left on glass. Aroma of tropical fruits and sweet malts. Taste is a let down...I get the citrus hop but it faint and somewhat watered down. Dry bitter finish that stays for a moment. I was expecting to be blown away and it did not happen. Maybe fresh on tap would be a different story. Price point and rating their are much better IPAs/DIPAs out there.
Good and very hoppy, a specialty from "The Region". Its not surprising it has such a high rating and ranking but likely could not be a session beer for most.

Bottle at home - 23/11/12 (thanks to George in NC).
Pours a mid amber colour with a big frothy white/off white head. Thins substantially after a minute or so, but retains a decent level and lacing follows.
Nose is fresh hops, pine, caramel malt, bitter grapefruit, mango.
Tastes of bitter grapefruit, bitter pine, caramel malts, light biscuit, mango, some mineral notes, touch of mango, light citrus, very fine sugars, resinous hops.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, bitter piney finish.
Excellent DIPA - alcohol is well disguised, flavours well balanced, all round great beer. Wish I could try this side by side with Pliny and Boneyard Hop Venom ! A Hyped beer @ allegedly.com that really delivered for me !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Slightly hazy light orange tan with average light white head which disipates quickly. Aroma of pine, cloves, floral notes, not too much aroma actually, whcih makes this beer decieving. Swirling full entry of multiple flavors , caraway, nutmeg, caramel, and sweet onions. Body is lighter than you think for this big beer, medium and refreshing , very drinkable for so much flavor. Only thing I did not care for was a cheese rind like taste at the end, bitter and it starys with you. Alcholol is completly masked, and with the lighter body this one can sneak up on you.
UPDATED: NOV 25, 2012 Pours a yellow-amber, frothy white head. Nice scratchy hop bite near the end; mango and sweetness all the way through. Surprised to see this has a 9.5% ABV!

Taken from my BA review dated 3/19/12

Live tasting bomber into Duvel tulip.. Huge thanks to rmcnealy for this one!

Appearance; pours a lovely hazy golden orange color with two fingers of loose off white colored head... Retention is decent, with a fairly thick film clinging to the top of the beer after a few minutes.. Lacing is solid with nice healthy clumps of lace clinging to the glass.

Smell; very subdued unfortunately, was hoping for a much more present aroma, unfortunately no bottle date to be found so im uncertain when this was bottled... An intense whiff yields pineapple, mango and some citrus.. A slight bready/yeasty aroma is also noticeable.

Taste; resinous notes are my initial impression, with pine being a primary component... Pineapple, mango orange and peach make a brief appearance... 

Mouthfeel; effervescent carbonation makes Dreadnaught feel lively in the mouth with a crisp finish and a slightly lingering bitterness...

Overall; I may have sat on this bottle a touch too long... Was originally waiting for a friend and finally said to hell with it and opened it up... I enjoyed this but definitely feel like a more fresh sample would have a lot more going on.. Would love to try another for comparison but at the moment I am unfortunately, a little underwhelmed given the reputation of this brew...

Bottle as shown. Pours a hazy yellow gold with small frothy off white head thats lasts awhile. The aroma is a strong floral hop and citrus. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet citrus hop and wheat with light bitterness on the finish. Hides alcohol well making it easy to drink, a very good IIPA from Three Floyds.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2013 On draft at the Brew pub, and many times out of a bottle before this.  Hazy golden orange color with a nice foamy head.  The aroma is not as strong and wonderful as many other Three Floyds hoppy beers (Zombie Dust comes to mind as a standout) Some faint citrus, a bit disappointing. The flavor makes up for it.  Bitter citrus with a hint of sweetness. Finishes dry.  Its very refreshing for such a big beer.  I just wish it had more of a nose.
Excellent IPA.... very similar to Gumaballhead, but doesnt taste nearly as hoppy/bitter as Zombie dust.

Pours a hazy tangerine color with a small white head. Aromas of citrus zest, some tropical fruits. Taste is some sweet pineapple with a hefty dose of harsh bitterness. Chemicals. No alcohol detected. Its ok. Wouldnt trade for again.

Pours a beautiful amber/orange with a great head. Thick head lingers with a little lacing in the glass. Aroma is not as strong as I expected but subtle citrus flavors. After letting is sit just a little and swirling the glass, an incredible aroma of carmel malt is noticeable and very nice. Palate is very smooth with a crisp finish. Excellent Imperial IPA.

Bottle at home, from my Minneapolis Town Hall glass. Ive been ISO this particular brew since 2009, and while I fully believe in the rule "Dont meet your heroes" this is a very big exception. Nose is just straight-up hop cones, massive grapefruit, grass, and pine; I really dont like to compare to Pliny, but this beer makes it hard not to. Flavours are perhaps a tad sweeter than I would like, but otherwise I can find absolutely nothing to complain about... Massive grapefruit, pine, great bitterness, super juicy, just spectacular! About as good an IIPA as you are likely to find.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2015 Pours clear light copper with medium head. Mega pine aroma with some nice citrus grapefruit. Wow. Flavor is pine and grapefruit with a nice malt balance. Slick mouthfeel with lingering hops. Awesome. Rated near the top for good reason. 

Thanks to Ryan0626 for the trade. Been seeking this out for a while, and my first Three Floyds brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from westlake in Chicago. Incredible aroma, perfect resiny hoppy flavor. This is one of the best 3F regulars.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mango and citrus to say the least, and then it bites back.  A must try!

22oz bottle- pours honey gold w/ nice off white head. Not quite clear, it has a ever so hazy appearance. Aroma is very nice blend of peach, pineapple, pine, & hint of alcohol. Taste follows suit. very, very well balanced. Mouthfeel is full & finish is bitter & lingering.
Bomber. Pours a hazy, light gold with no head. Flavor is incredible. Fruity hops with a great malt balance. Some alcohol flavor which enhances the overall beer. One of the best IIPAs I have ever had.
Absolutely perfect.  Mango and peach aroma (as described).  Strong mango flavor as well with a malty finish.  Full palate.
From a 22 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a cloudy dark gold with a thick white head. Aroma of grapefruit  followed by a melange of fruits. Silky bitter finish
lived up to expectations, fantastic beer, even after making the cross country flight in a checked back. bottle from louisville, ky

Strong hoppy ipa! Aroma of mango, peach, sweet Orange and biscuit. Really bitter but well balanced 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ive had this beer so many times, I could probably review it without drinking it, but here we go. Pours a sunset golden orange color with a nice finger-length off white head. Head dissipates fairly slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Just smells amazing. Tons of resinous mango, pineapple, peach. Also tropical fruits like papaya or something like that. Very sweet smell from the carmel malt I imagine. Taste begins with an abrasive bitterness. Then fades nicely into a mouthful of tropical and citrus fruits. Finishes with a fruity, bready, sweet malt. All the while that bitterness is lingering around. The sweet, bitter fruit finish sticks around. Nice creamy mouthfeel and is full bodied. Such a smooth tasting beer. Beers this big I usually would not put in the category of "refreshing", but this one definitely is. One of the best imperial ipas out there.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2013 Bottle via trade with Drew. Pours clear amber with a large off-white head and some lacing. Aroma is muted; pine, herbal, grass and light caramel. Flavor is grass, pine, light metallic, light citrus, and malty bread and caramel. Medium bitter, lightly sweet, medium alcoholic bitter dry finish. Body is medium. May have been a bit past prime. Rerate with a fresher bottle, better citrus aroma, quite hot and bitter on the finish

Bottle, deep golden color, large sticky head and lacing. The nose is faint, hard to pick out particular notes, but definitely pine, some grass. Good pine flavor, grass, some slight bread and yeast character as well. Feels muted relative to other peoples descriptions - maybe dated?

On tap at Brew Pub.  Pours a slightly hazy orangish amber color with a one finger white soapy head with good retention and lacing throughout.  Nice hoppy aroma of grapefruit, pine, citrus, and apricot, with sweet, caramelly, bready malt.  Taste starts a bit sweet, then quickly explodes into a hop assault of grapefruit rind, pine resin, citrus, and apricot.  The malt manages to keep a light presence throughout, with a lingering malty sweetness that has a caramelly and bready flavor that maintains some balance. Finishes coarse and bitter with a touch of alcohol.  Thick and chewy mouthfeel with an everlasting aftertaste.
the most amazing smelling beer ive ever had. quite a punch, plenty bitter and MADE IN INDIANA.

Had this on-tap at Three Floyds brewpub. Poured into a half pint.

A: Pours a dark golden apple color with a fluffy 1 finger white head. Has some decent retention and leaves a nice sticky lace on the way down.

S: Im picking up some citrus hops right of the bat. A little combination of lemon and lime peels with an orange zest. A sweet malty caramel backbone shines through at the end.

T: Nice caramel malts from the nose shine through more on the tongue and are the perfect compliment to fresh citrus hops that flourish in this brew. It has a mild bitterness on the finish with a slight alcohol taste merged in there, but there is no burn.

M: Light bodied with a nice carbonation. Has a nice vine/grass and woody finish on the palate.

O: Another great DIPA from FFF. I love tasting the differences between each one and this one is no different. Great beer and perfectly balanced.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 08-27-2011

As a DIPA lover this is in my top 5. OK top 3 behind only Hopslam and one yet to be announced. 
Excellent balance of all of what an imperial should be!!
bomber from the source. pour is deep orange with cloud like head. aroma of hops smacks you as soon as the cap comes off citrus/grass/weed. taste is well balanced between hop/sweet and dry

22 oz thanks to drfabulous. Dark golden color with a nice white head, very little lace. Aroma of pine and citrus, very enticing. Taste is that of peach, citrus and lots of hoppy goodness! Very smooth mouthfeel. Awesome beer! Probably my new favorite imperial ipa and maybe new favorite beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
22 ounce bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy orange gold with a nice white head.  Aroma of citrus, pine, caramel, and malt.  Taste is citrus hops, pine, florals, some malt, and some alcohol.  Top notch!

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2013 WAHH amazing sweetness - malts and hops, with tons of ripe tropical fruits. Leaves an incredible lacing. Has a spectacular balance of fruity hops and caramel malts. Feels amazing to top it off. This beer is truly fantastic

Jesus. First off, Ive rarely if ever gotten so much off the nose of a beer. Grapefruit, pine, mangos, passion fruit, oranges, spruce, resin. Amazing. Tastes follows through on the promise. One of the best beers Ive ever had.

Pours a dark gold with a two finger white foamy head.  Great lacing. Smell is delicious.  Citrus fruits, grass, and hops.  Taste is citrus hops with a backend of a touch of caramel malt.  Can't taste the ABV.  Very good Imperial IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Snifter.  Hazy amber peach colour.  Thick, permanent white head.  Plenty of lacing.  Resinous aroma with grapefruit and tropical fruits.  Very bitter flavour up front.  Orange and grapefruit zest, mild tea, toasted malts and pine.  Long bitter finish.
Dark golden with heavy white lace. Nectarine and mango aromas complement the brown sugar and piney flavour. Medium body with a very juicy lemon finish.
Clean as a whistle. Pineapple/grapefruit nose with plenty of resin. Thick and slick with a sugar coating on the teeth. High and tight bitter finish.
Aroma is hoppy with hints of fruit. Slight hint of malt and caramel, not much, hut also hoppy on the finish. Very smooth overall. An amazing IPA indeed

Medium orange with a very thin head. Plenty of floral hops in the aroma, as well as some pine. Alcohol is detectable, as is expected in an Imperial IPA, but not very prominent. The hops are powerful from start to finish, but balanced well with sweet malts.
Strong aroma of caramel and hops.  Pours a dark amber. Taste of hops with a hint of caramel.  Abv is well hidden.

Bottle, direct from the brewery, thanks to QuezXLV.  This one comes in with expectations hard to live up to.  The aroma is a sweet grapefruit with some floral and pine.  Complexion is light amber with white head, which soon fades. The flavor is well hopped without biting with a touch of caramel.   ABV is well hidden.  Overall a top notch double IPA, but perhaps a bit overrated. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A-- Poured a slightly hazy but almost clear amber orange. Bright white head that was a half a finger and went to film. Good head retention though. Good lacing and good alcohol legs to this. Little carbonation shown with this. Looks good. 

S-- Good nose. Bright, vibrant citrus, whith just hints of malt. Candied orange, candied pineapple, mango and papaya. Mouthwatering smell to this. 

T-- Not as big and aggressive as West Coast DIPAs are but good. Mouth gets tangerine, orange, grapefruit and a bit of lime. Malt is minimal at best. No alcohol taste at all. 

M-- Medium bodied and closer to medium high carbonation. Lots of bitter grapefruit and bitter orange peel in the back and finish. Very clean finish in the back. Very creamy in the front. 

O-- Impressive, very impressive. On par with the best Western US DIPAs and to me the best of the Midwest. Easy to drink, well hidden ABV, and just tasty.
Very smooth for a beer with an ABV of 9. Has aromas of  apricot and is caramel in color. Also finishes dry. It is packed with all of the favors of an awesome IPA.
Bomber - light orange in color with a medium head and foamy lacing. Has a floral/citrus aroma and an orange peel taste. Has a medium-heavy oily mouthfeel and a dry finish.
Golden color. Quite clear. Descent head. Very hoppy bouquet. Grapefruit and a touch of malt. Very malty start with a long bitter and citrusy finish.

Draft at brewpub over a year back. Pours clear golden straw with big light off white head and lace. Aromas of pine, grains and grapefruit dominate the nose. Very inviting. Medium light body, moderate to high bitterness, balanced with the residual sweetness. Finish is brilliant with the bitterness lingering on making it oh so satisfying. Faultless.
Pours a nice golden color. Fair head retention. Very hoppy aroma. Citrus up front with a heavy hop smell and taste in the finish. A good beer for the hop enthusiast. Definitely recommend this one.

It poured a light orange color with a thin white head. The aroma was of tangerine, orange, grapefruit, grass, pine, some bread and a hint of barnyard. The taste was pine, grass, resin, alcohol warmth, orange, tangerine, grapefruit, with a warming bitter finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Very tasty, one of the best Imperial IPAs I have tried.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2012 As soon as I poured this I knew it was going to be awesome.  The citrus hops and fruity aromas are very strong from the initial pour.  The taste is smooth and light bitter with some sweetness.  I wasnt able to detect the 9 1/2 percent alcohol.  A modern treasure.

Pale light orange/peach.Short froth good lacing.
Tropical/ripe fruit  some pine with a spicy buiscuity malt slighty bready.
 Nice sweet carmel with a strong hop flavor  with tropical fruit tones that compliment each other well,not boozy but strength is noticed in the finish with a semi stong pine but very smooth bittering.Very nice from strart to finish,very good overall tasteting beer.Probably like this better than hopslam or hoptimum.
One of the best ipas Ive had. Extremely smooth and intense in hops but not too bitter. Nice sweet aftertaste.

Pour slightly hazy yellow, with a big creamy white head. 
Aroma is big of tropical fruits, mango, caramel, slight pine. This isnt as crazy As expected, but very well balanced. 
Taste is a little sweet up front, with a rather long, bitter and slightly dry aftertaste. 
Average body, with a semi- fizzy carbonation. - thanks to Sean for sending me this.
Excellent offering from a great brewery.  Not as much of a hop assault as I thought it might be, but rather downplayed in about of some malt balance. Tried with Jay in KC in 2012

Acquired this in a trade around DLD12 so its not as fresh as it should be. Enjoyed at fridge temp into a snifter. 

A - Burnt orange with hints of brown. Nice clarity, no head.

S - Big citrus scent. Not as nice as it could be fresh. Certainly subdued compared to friend. Very intense toasted caramel scent.

T - Wow. Alright. Im getting orange peels, lemon zest and burnt brown sugar. Gigantic malt backbone and a hint of crystal. Big caramel finish.

M - 100% carbonation on the mouth swish. Medium high buddy.

O - Very good. Id love to have this fresh! Still, very drinkable. A bomber all to myself at 9.5%..oh boy.

Pours dark orange with frothy white head. Nice lacing. Aroma and flavour: hops, mango (among other tropical fruits), malt. Taste is well balanced and complex. Nice bitterness. Carbonation is intense.
