Very refreshing. Amazing beer. Alcohol is well hidden for its 9,5%, so watch out if you drink it on a hot sunny day.

Bomber to snifter (from notes).  Looks good; deep with low carbonation and thin lacing.  Smells good too; nice and hoppy.  Tastes great!  A big DIPA with wonderful balance and a good mouthfeel.  A top-notch beer thats on a short list with the best DIPAs out there.

Pours a hazy gold with two finger head with moderate lacing. Moderately bitter with lemon nitter hops and toasted malt.very bright hop flavor. Medium body mild carbonation. Very long finish. Fantastic beer.

The golden color and fruity flavor make this one incredible Imperial IPA.  When served from the bottle the flavor is wonderful but it is even more delicious when tapped and served in the company of friends.

Bottle (22 oz). Huge thanks to Sean9689! Unclear orange with a medium white head and superb lacing. Explosive aroma of mango, grapefruits, tropical fruits, malt and hops. Smell fresh! Taste of mango, grapefruits, tropical fruits and malt/caramel. Medium to heavy bitterness and lively carbonation. This IIPA is a masterpiece! Quite complex, well balance (even with 100 IBU), extremely drinkable and refreshing and I didnt fell the 9,5% abv.

Has a really killer citrus/grapefruit scent with a nice hop presence. Taste is a really well balanced pine hop taste and a light caramel sweetness. Super smooth for the style, very easy drinking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to OmegaX for the share. This one lives up to the hype. With aromas of caramel, pineapple, honey and fresh hops - it doesnt get much better. Alcohol flavors are very well hidden, perhaps masked by the fresh citrus and grassy notes. A very well balanced and surprisingly session-able brew.

Bottle into snifter. My 4th of July celebratory brew! And a big thanks to Matboz for sending this one my way! Nose was full of tropical fruit! Some very powerful mango and pineapple juice aromas were followed up with pine and light grapefruit notes. Tons of honey mango aromas. Awesome! Pour was fuzzy orange with a white head. Flavors match the nose with plenty of pineapple and mango upfront. Maybe some peach or nectarine notes, too. A nice caramel malt finish. Nice and balanced. Very good.
very nicely citrus hopped beer with a sweet aftertone.  one of the most well balanced IPAs and extremely smooth for a 9.5abv brew
Bottle: Poured a copper orange color with a thick off white head. Aroma is nice citrus bold hops. Big hop bomb up front with nice mellowing back end.

On tap @ Mikkeller bar. This is a deep honey orange beer with a nice small dense off-white head. Strong piny hoppy and fruity as hell aroma, lots of citrus, sticky sweet caramel, pine cones, concentrated peaches juice and grapefruit. Its average carbonated with a thick and oily almost sticky texture. Lovely fruit hoppy flavors, really sweet also - but perfectly balanced after a while in the mouth. Lasting grapy bitter and fruity citrus finish with a hint of warming alcohol! Damn fine one and the last beer @ our Copenhagen trip for this time. 13.05.2012
Lots of citrus, pine, hops and caramel. Creamy and smooth to drink given the high alcohol content. May be my favorite IPA ever.

Fresh bottle purchased from the FFF brewery. Poured into a goblet and consumed Dec 30, 2009.

A: Clean, sunburst and autumn leaves hues, moderate head with mild lacing that fades over a few minutes.

S: Citrus fruits, piney, candy, nice sweetness from the hops, big hop presence (did I mention hops?), faint alcohol

T: A big hoppy brew, and balanced well for the style. I took about an hour and half to drink this, enjoying the pleasant warming sensation and lingering aftertaste. No astringency in the finish whatsoever.

M: Awesome! Extremely smooth and creamy, especially given the ABV. Coats your mouth with a sweet sticky feel. Finishes great with a nice lingering aftertaste.

D: One of my favorite DIPA. Very drinkable, given the 10% ABV. One of the best. Highly recommended.
Amazing palate with a tremendous amount of hops well blended with malt. Perfect bitterness that rounds out the beer. Heavy with a slight citrus twang.

Stopped at Delocks while passing on route 80. This was one of three they had. It lives up to the hype. Pours golden amber with a thin lacing head. The aroma has biscuit and malt, some grass and some fruit. The flavor starts with just a touch of malt sweetness and then the hops take over. Citrus and pine, fruity and dry. A very good beer to say the least.
Draft.  Thick frothy head.  Great citrus aroma.  Incredibly smooth with no after taste.  Absolutely loved it.

Pours cloudy orange with small white head that leaves some soapy lacing. Aroma is pretty light, typical citrusy DIPA. Flavor is outstanding. Citrus up front with just the right amount of caramel malt to make it incredibly drinkable while still retaining enough hops bitterness to call it an IPA.

On tap at Timothy OTooles in Gurnee. One of the best tasting beers Ive ever had. Light amber color with a nice creamy head and lacing. Very floral and fruity aroma. Well balanced bitterness and maltiness with a great taste that lingers for a while. Good mouthfeel and a slight alcohol feel but exactly how it should be. One of the most enjoyable experiences drinking a beer.
This is a perfect beer.  If you dont like it, youre a terrible person and your children probably hate you.
Large amounts of grapefruit and lemon juice, maltier than I had expected, rich.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Deep amber color with no head. The nose is light pineapple, fresh hoppiness, sweet fruits and strawberry malts. The taste is spicy floral garden, very sweet strawberry jam with a very hoppy grassy finish. The bodys nice, full though a bit too malt-forward for my liking. Overall, a nice DIPA, but not my favorite offering from this brewery.
Faint floral hoppy nose.  Fruit forward taste...ends very dry.  Extremely full bodied...but almost seems muted and toned down.  A good beer, but only an average Imperial IPA.

Pours cloudy, peach-orange with tall, light tan head.
Scent is strong tropical fruits, hops.
Taste is an eye-popping hoppiness at first sip, then mellowing as your receptors do a re-boot.
Sweet tropicals vs. hops, vs. caramel/ breads.....
Dreadnaught is an apt name for this.  Its a gigantic battlewagon of taste and sensation.
Awesome.....and Im not even a huge IPA disciple.
A must-have for anyones list of great beers.
Orange hazy pour into half pint glass. Minimal white head. Sweet grassy scent. Light sweet flavor with a small amount of hop presence. Sour after taste.

Golden orange appearance with an almost white head and nice sticky lacing drapes the glass. Sweet, citrus hops taste all the way through. Taste is vibrant with intense tropical fruits, and nice bittering hops. Alcohol is very well masked. The benchmark for which all IIPAs should be compared to.
amber with medium head. huge hoppiness with fantastic mix of hops. nearly flawless as far as ipas go.

Tap @ Mikkeller bar. Pours golden with white head. Aroma of malt, fresh fruity hops, citrus, bit of booze. Taste is bready malt, caramel, tropical fruit, peach, mango, lots of citrusly hops, oranges and grapefruit. Medium body, soft carbonation, slight warming alcohol in the finish. Wonderful IIPA. 120512

Big huge Hoppy monster that I now will have wet dreams about. Citrusy mango little bit of pine aroma then tastes exactly like it smells and goes down easier than, easier than, well easy just plain easy. Its so freaking good. I wish I didnt have to share the bomber with other people. That was the only disappointment. My favorite beer so far.

Awesome. There is not really much to say that has not been said. If you like hoppy IPA's this well be one of the best you ever had 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber. Nice brew. Aroma is typical west coast. Cloudy hazy dipa. It's old as I got it from Sergio's. Nice beer but by the time I had this it's been ripped and clone a lot. Very nice but not worth the drive up to get. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Appearance: clear golden orange with foamy white head. Aroma: like the description, bright peach, mango, citrus hop BLAST! Taste: a beautiful hopathon touching all the aroma notes above with a great smooth bitterness and a balanced caramel malt backbone. Mouthfeel: mildly creamy, med. carbonation. Overall:  lived up to the hype for me. Blew me away. The multiple hop characteristics balance so perfectly with the malt. It's really an amazing beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted at Holy Grale in Louisville. Was on tap. Truly an amazing beer. Complemented the food, which was awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Pours like every other iipa.  I get pineapple in the aroma, but maybe I am crazy.  The taste is flat out awesome.  This is pretty much what I and everyone else out there has come to expect from 3Fs.  Great beer all the way around.

700th Rating!  Bomber purchased at Bourbon & Canal in Terre Haute, Indiana while on a business trip there last month ($10.29). Pours into small hotel glass a somewhat murky light amber color with a half finger of white head.  Aroma of sweet fruits (mango and citrus just as the label says), honey, fresh-cut grass, fresh-cut flowers, alcohol, and some dank hoppiness.  Flavor includes notes of sharp citrus (ruby red grapefruit) as well as sweeter and more mellow fruits (peach and tangerine), notably spicy hops, pine, and toasted caramel.  Though bottled, the hops have a very fresh quality, reminding me somewhat of a wet hop ale.  Strangely, the flavor actually improved as it warmed up.  The significant malt backbone leads to a remarkably well-balanced big beer, with a nice mixture of bitterness and sweetness.  Smooth and restrained considering the big ABV (though some detectable booze in the nose).  This is quite different from the really hop-heavy FFF Arctic Panzer Wolf that I tried earlier in the day.  Glad that I finally got to try this excellent beerwould love to try it on draft some day.  (1685, 700)

Pours an orange caramel color into my ccb snifter with a one finger head that disapates fast. Aroma of tropical fruits with a malty butterscotch backbone. Taste follows the nose, great citric hop taste with a sweet caramel malt leaving this fairly balanced but still a bit sweeter than the top dipas that I have tried. This is a great dipa but not the best, I dont think I will be seeking this out again.

(on tap @ Mikkeller Bar) Pours clear amber with medium, white head. Good retention and nice lace. Aroma like apricot jam. Full body, oily texture, lively carbonation and quite a bitter finish wrapped in jammy, fruity flavours. Slightly warming alcohol as well. Taste is initially sweet followed by bitterness. Best balanced DIPA I ever had.

This is my kind of beer. Tested it on draft at mikkeller bar in Chopenhagen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Mikkeller Bar. It pours light orange, with a thin white head. The nose is tangerine, orange, grapefruit, resin, leaf, grass, pine, brown bread and a touch of farmyard. The taste is pine, leaf, grass, resin, alcohol warmth, orange, tangerine and grapefruit, with a warming, bitter finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Quite boozy actually. Good stuff, but its not the most drinkable IIPA Ive had.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear gold with an orange hue and a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of pine hops with a bit of grapefruit and underlying sweet grains. Flavor begins with very bitter pine hops witha good amount of backing sweet grains with a hint of underlying grapefrut.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar.
Pours clear amber color with small head. Aroma of apricot, mandarin, orange peel and mild caramel. Flavour of exotic fruits, caramel, toffee and pine needles. Very nicely hopped iipa.
4616

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.
Pours a hazy copper orange colour with a small head. Aroma of strong floral hops, exotic fruits and heavy caramel. Quite heavy flavour of floral hops, exotic fruits such as kiwi, caramel and lemon. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a long, fruity and floral hoppy finish. Excellent.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar
Aroma is hoppy and sweetish with exotic fruits and some resin. Flavour is extremely hoppy with biscuits, fruits, forest, pine needles and resin. Sweet feeling in the middle of a sip, but not sticky after all. Slight warming alcohol afterwards. Refreshing and nice.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen

Pours clear dark orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of lovely fresh fruits, citrusy hops, lemon, caramel, toffee. Taste is very fruity with some sweetness, fresh hops, grapefruit, caramel, lemon and citrus. Finish is bitter and fruity. Extremely well balanced and tasty.

Re-rated at Three Floyds Bar. Still quite tasty but I like the more fruity Permanent Funeral more.
Pours orange hue with impeccable aroma of grapefruit.  Massive flavor of hops and malt; this is a supercharged hop juice.  Very nicely done.

22oz bomber bottle. bright copper in color with a frothy white head. nice retention and ok lacing on the glass. strong citric aroma, grapefruit, mango and and orange. hops all the way through with a nice balance of malt. bitter dry finish.

Great bold in your face hops. Slightly sugary on the tongue. Beautiful color, flowery nose. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally reviewed: 6/2/09. Poured into my snifter. Pours a hazy deep gold with about a half inch white head on top. Some decent lacing is left behind. The scent on this is rivaled only by the brothers Pliny. I could wear this as a cologne if possible. Huge piney floral hoppiness going on. Big bountiful scents just burst forth and bombard the nose. Absolutely wonderful!

Mouthfeel is crisp and pleasant for drinkability. Flavor is not as bitter and hoppy as I expected, but it is good nonetheless. Slight bitter hops right at the onset, but this gives way to a very sweet finish. This is balanced as all get out. Drinkability = freaking better believe it! I could drink this all night.

Incredible hop aroma as soon as you pop the cap. Pours copper with fluffy white head that quickly dissipates.  Amazing smell of citrus fruits, strawberry, pine and cereal. Obviously big hops overpower but this has a huge caramel malt back end too. Really bitter finish. World class beer.

Apariencia: color naranja claro, un poco turbio, corona media, blanca, persistente. Carbónico medio.
Aroma: Impresionante, muy intenso a mango, frutas tropicales, piña, notas florales y melocotón. 
Sabor: mucho cuerpo, poco carbónico, un poco seco y amargo, mucha fruta, cítricos y sobre todo, fruta tropical. Toques a caramelo, por la malta. Retrogusto muy largo. Alcohol muy bien integrado.

Bottle.  Slightly hazey gold color with light gold head.  Before Im done pouring I can smell hops! Just like the smell, you taste hops upfront, followed by the fruits and bitterness. Similar to the west coast ipas but with a midwest twist. I like

I am lucky enough to live a short 2 hour drive from the Three Floyds Brewpub and was able to have this beer for the first time there. I had consumed an APA, IPA, and Barley Wine before I ordered this beer. I absolutely loved it, but wasnt sure if it was the previous three pints talking or the fact that my taste buds had been skewed at that point. Ive since had this beer several times locally and this is by far my favorite IIPA.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2012 Incredible.  Simply incredible.  Awesome sweet ruby grapefruit up front, lots of bitter piney hops, and a long, citrusy, yet dry finish.  Perfectly balanced DIPA.  Its laughing at me.

Excited to have on tap at the Firkin for my 300th rating. Pours a hazy yellowish-orange with an off-white head. Perfect concentric circles of lacing - how can the appearance not be a 5 with that? Aroma has strong citrus fruits, orange and grapefruit, with a sweet floral presence. Taste brings sweet caramel with overwhelming citrus fruits. Quite syrupy. Finishes very long and with a nice bitter and sweet mix. Some alcohol presence, more felt than tasted. Three Floyds does hops sooooo well!
This is what a DIPA should taste like. Alot of hops with a smell the fills the room.

Butterscotch pour with ample frothy white head with decent retention.  Nose of hops, apricots, and other citrus fruits.  Taste is hop forward, middle and back with a decent malt backbone.  Plenty of fruit notes.  Not PtY or Alpine Expo but still very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a copper color with a small white head. Aroma is citrus and grapefruit hops. Taste is also citrus and floral hops balanced nicely with a malty background. Medium body.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2013 Aromatics start with citrus mainly grapefruit, pine, and solid alcohol notes. Pours deep gold with thick sticky pure white head. Taste starts deep and bitter with lots of citrus and floral hops. Overall really nice.

Pricey 22 oz. bottle from Table and Vine, West Springfield, MA.  Snifter showed an amber color with gold like hue. Great retention. Powerful nose of grapefruit, mango, peach and sweet malt. Sometimes I wonder if the power of suggestion is found on commercial descriptions, because now I think and smell nothing but lots of fruit. Taste follows the aromas. And very well played DIPA.  Subtle bitterness and in perfect balance.  Slick oily like texture. Compared this today side-by-side with Hopslam. For me I like Bells a bit better but this brew has no flaws and really is a masterpiece as well. Even if a tad over priced at some bottle shops.

This one pours a light copper orange with a creamy white head. It smells bready with citrus zest. The lacing is magnificent leaving fine bubbly patches behind. The taste is light citrus hops, with a mix of barnyard and cashew balanced by a velvety malt presence with a nice warming alcohol fuzz on the back end. It all comes together for a light, crisp, refreshing brew.

Thjx to shrubber85 for this oen ! 
Head: bubbly, off white, away pretty fast 
Colour: orangy amber 
Smell: exotic, lots of hops mostly fruity and fresh, lychee, bittersweer. 
Taste: start is creamy a tiny bit sweet , and then comes in a very nice fruity hopy flavour followed by a bit exotic and bitter/fresh flavour , the fruityness contains flavours like peach, lychee,lime,mango,bit of green banana, while the bitter/fresh flavour contains a bit bacteria/yeasty flavour and at the same time citric and grassy "fresh" flavours , end is very dry with a bit of booze and a flavour of white grapes, aftertaste is pineapple and grassy, very very nice !!

clear golden white head crazy lacing nice retention... ridiculous aroma, peach mango stonefruits, light sweetness and some citrus... huge hoppy flavor accented by stonefruits and some citrus, with a light sweetness that goes otherwise unnoticed... lively medium body dry dry dry finish...

Bomber. Clear, amber/deep gold liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, cereal malt, tropical fruit, pine (lots of pine), caramel and fresh hops. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter with lots of fruity, hoppy notes. Delicious. Medium bodied with nice carbonation. Nice DIPA with lots of fruity flavour but less pungent aroma than I expected. Taste is really nicely balanced.
Bottle pours a hazy orange with a thin lacing white head. Scent is pine, citrus and caramel. Taste is caramel with massive citrus and pine. Amazing!
From a bottle poured an amber color with a fair amount of head.  Nice hoppy flavor with a lingering finish.
UPDATED: APR 16, 2012 Reminiscent of dark lord - but triple A vs pro league. Wonderful aroma, sweet delicious brew.  Very fruity.

22 oz bomber into a Three Floyds pint glass. 

A - Dark amber body. Soapy one finger off-white head. Tight bubbling with low retention.

S - Super juicy grapefruit with some tropical fruit. A touch of pine, caramel malts and an earthy, almost grainy metallic finish. 

T - Grapefruit juice. Lots of pineapple and peach with hints of malt. Super fresh, floral, and sour. Lightly bitter finish lingers for a bit. Medium body mouth feel with adequate carbonation.

O - A grapefruit lovers beer. Ive never had a D/IPA come off so strong with grapefruit. Really delicious stuff, though I found the nose to be a bit metallic.

Boomer to a pint glass.  Amber  with a little cloudiness.  Limited head.  Sme fruit on the nose with a solid amount of hops.  No alcohol taste but some heat on the finish.  Very good double ipa, but a notch below hopslam in my book.

Draught at brewery. Beautiful color. Incredibly hoppy and intense without being too much. Zesty and crisp. Highly enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ultra fresh bottle compliments of Carlo, this years batch was better then I remember. Poured an ultra hazy glowing orange color. Medium head with awesome lacing. Tangy hops, sweet malts, grapfruits, and other citrus. Great palate and just the right amount of bitterness.
Best beer I have ever tasted period! From the best brewery on the planet! Absolutely amazing

Bottle.  Pours a golden brown with a thick foamy head.   Tons of citrus hops aroma up front with just a bit of malt.   Taste is lots of citrus hops, and a malty earthy balance.   Palate is a bit thick and the alcohol is extremely well hidden.   In my opinion well deserving of its high rating.

Absolutely stunning.  Pours a hazy golden with a thinner head.  Contains a floral aroma with citrus, hops, and a bit of pine.  Taste is very hoppy and very floral.  I can taste grapefruit and some pine as well.  All of these flavors are very active to give this tremendous flavor.  Aftertaste is strongly hoppy and floral.  Palate is thick and chewy, yet very drinkable.  I am extremely impressed with this beer.  I could literally gush about this all night I am that pleased.

Brown color ale with a huge off-white foamy head with pretty good retention. Aroma is floral hops. Taste is delicate floral sweet hops on top of well balance malt. Body is full and alcohol is well hidden.

Poured from an (undated) bomber into an oversized wine glass.  Not too worried about the date, I picked up the bottle at the brew pub a week earlier.  Pours with a couple inches of thick white head.  Light amber color with little lacing.  Tropical fruit and straw aroma.  Some strawberries as well.  Mouthfeel is moderate but it has way too much carbonation that makes me burpy and takes away from the experience.  Taste is mainly of tropical fruit, dirt (um, I mean earthy) straw, some metallic taste, light pine and lemon.  Plenty of bitter grapefruit rind as well.  Overall, an excellent DIPA but a bit too bitter for me.  Id buy it often if it was available in my area.

Clear gold with a thin white head that lasts, should have more head. Up front citrus hop aroma with a hint of malt.  Good citrus hop flavor followed by light maltiness.   Medium body, moderate hop bitterness that lingers, creamy.  Well done.  The aroma & flavors are bold but not over the top.
On tap at CCB for Hunahpus day. Very earthy and bitter, a good bit of gritty maltiness to it. Its not my favorite but still pretty good.
22oz bottle, amber pour with white head, tropic fruit aroma, same taste with some malt and caramel to balance it out.  The alcohol is well hidden in this one, careful.  Awesome IPA.

Bottle thanks to HombrePalo

Pours a bit darker than your standard IPA, nice three fingers white head, moderate retention. Literally gushing with flavor right off the bat. Citrus, pine, resin, lemongrass and grapefruit. Taste is bitter but not overpowering. Very grassy, floral. Almost a bit chalky texture, sticky. Decent drinkability. Its a pretty good IPA, not all that wild about it though. Bit unique though.
Bottle. Amber pour with nice head. Incredible hop balance. Almost perfect. Not as smooth as zombie dust but incredibly balanced. Really fantastic.

Pours a clear rich amber colour with a small creamy white head that dissipates. Strong fruit scents and aromas of citrus hops, a little pine and slight caramel present as well. Taste is sweet initially, but becomes strongly bitter through the after taste, which lingers a while. Medium body, smooth on the palate and normal carbonation. An excellent beer, so gad I got to try this one, easily a top 10 for me.

Tasted on draft at the Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, Illinois.  Almost amber in color, very frothy head.  Aroma is very light especially in comparison to zombie dust.  You can taste hints of caramel and intense hops.  A very nice ipa, but I found myself enjoying zombie dust more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fresh bomber poured in a duvel tulip. Nice clear orange amber with a white 2 finger head. Excellent lacing. Aroma is tropical fruit. Mango, pineapple, and bright citrus is apparent. Flavor is grapefruit, tropical fruit, peach, and a nice caramel malt balance. It goes down really easy and the 9.5% abv is practically invisible. The mouthfeel is medium and the flavor lingers on the tongue. This is the standard I judge DIPAs by.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2012 22oz bottle.
This is a beer Ive wanted to try for a very long time - finally getting the chance!  Nose of mango, tropical fruit, dank hops, and some sweetness.  Flavor is a near perfect mix of sweet malt and hop punch - bitterness is present but not overpowering.  Fruity and crazy easy to drink.  I would drink this regularly if it was available in my area.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a nice short head. The aroma will knock your socks off, with a great citrus hoppy smell. The taste is nothing but flavor, the hops are bitter and citrusy and just bathe the palate. Well balanced, a great finish and I wish I could score more. Arguably, perhaps the best double IPA made. Quaff Score ( drinkability with hearty enjoyment ) 9 / 10

UPDATED: APR 30, 2013 Pours orange with a small white head and hoppy aroma. Taste is bitter and sweet, very hoppy with tastes of grapefruit and a continuing bitter finish throughout. Delicious brew and very good.

Poured a golden orange into a tulip, with a great two finger head, which was suprising for the high ABV. Smells of pine, grapefruit, zest, and resin. Taste is bitter upfront with a grassy middle, bitter finish and a hint of alcohol. Solid IPA, but a little heavy on the alcohol for me.

Cloudy and light orange or copper colored liquid. Smells of grapefruit pith, gentle pine needle, and apricot. Much more fruity than I was expecting. Tastes is rich sweet with nice grapefruit bitter.  The hops hit front and high, then they drop lower and to the back of the mouth. Great bitter with a nice aromatic hoppy aftertaste.

Bottle pours orange-gold with a creamy eggshell head. Aroma is sweet and sticky with notes of caramel, mango, tangerine, apricot, orange zest, and pine resin. Flavor shows the same with additional notes of honey covered peaches. Overall body is moderate to full and finishes with bitterness to complement. Good stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2012 A pours nice unfiltered tangerine amber with some off white head that disapates . S - aromas of orange and grapefruit hops, grass and pine notes as well. Caramel malts as well. M - high carb medium body brew, well balanced. Lingering malty end. T - citrus and piney hops on the nose with some grassiness. Transitions nicely to mellow guava, sweet citrus notes and caramel malts. Nice fresh citrus and sun tea bitters. O - very good imperial ipa. Well balance and very fresh. 8

From notes.  First reviewed 5/6/2010.  Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tulip. 

Dreadnaught pours an amber tangerine color with a strong 4 cm white head. Great retention, especially for a DIPA, and sticky lace all over the glass.

There are some sweet caramel malt notes in the aroma, but this a hop-centric beer. Pleasant aroma of tangerine, mango, grapefruit, and apricot hops. 

Lightly sweet all the way through, even with the hop assault. A variety of citrus flavors - orange and grapefruit mostly, as well as peach and some floral notes. Very strong and robust flavor. I love it. The alcohol is completely hidden. How, I have no idea. Mildly bitter aftertaste. 

How is Dreadnaught this creamy? It is so smooth, so so creamy. Lightly carbonated, but it suits the flavor quite well. The strong hops leave my tongue tingling with a slightly oily residue. Fairly subdued, given the flavor.

Just keep it coming. I have a weak spot for DIPAs, and this is one of the best I have had. With a great taste and incredible smoothness, this is a very drinkable brew. The alcohol is not even noticeable, except for the pleasant warming of the stomach. Delicious. I drank this solo, but it would be a great pairing for some spicy food.

Poured a hazy golden orange with a nice cream colored head.  Left a ton of lacing.  Aroma was grapefruit, peach, and piney hops.  Taste is fruit, grass, and pine. Really nice bitterness that lasts.  Silky on the palate. Nice dry finish. Really good.

Bottle shared by Kabutomushi. Nose of solid malts, light caramel, big grass, light citrus, alcohol burn. Clear ciopper color with lace. Peach and tropical fruits come out later. Well assembled flavor with strong alcohol, tasty malts, without caramel overload, citrus and an interesting light fruitiness. Not so bitter, enough but not huge. Dry, earthy, grassy. Green fruits coming out. Clean and crisp. Quite drinkable, though not mind-blowing. Maybe this could use a bit of age.

I have had a few of the higher rated IPAs and this one is the best. Three Floyds makes some amazing beers that are often very hyped. This one lives up to the hype and possibly exceeds it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Archer Liquor. Pours hazy copper with white head.Mango and pine on the nose. Just slightly hoppy. Rich and malty. Creamy with bitter finish.
Copper clear pour.  Big citrus blast in face.  Gair ampunt if malt hidden under big citrus piny hoppy goodness.  Bitter but not overly bitter for amount of hops.

Poured a golden hue with moderate carbonation. Smelled of citrus fruits and a malty body. Tastes very citrusy and the maltiness doesnt come around until the end. The bitterness is present throughout and is only slightly balanced with the maltiness.

A brute.  Bomber, Mango and citrus head, Copper body, half inch white head,
Resiny malt body overshadowed by some hop madness, and then some. When you talk about DIPAs , this a benchmark brew.  Citrus, Pine, bitter, hoppy, yep, and then some.

Bottle purchased at the source. Pours a perfectly clear amber colour. White head that is super active, recedes to about a half a finger, and leaves behind huge clumps of lacing. Smells like super fruity, all the classics, grapefruit, tangerine, mango and a little peach. Tastes bitter but doesnt stay with you forever. Quite silky smooth on the tongue. Great brew.
Three floyds is one of my favorite breweries and this brew tops the list from there. Awesome!

I love this beer and I drink it on a regular basis on tap at the brewpub and out of the bottle. This makes it very hard for me to give an accurate review... but I must try.

Ive seen this beer come out cloudy on some pours and clear on some pours... Ive even seen it pour cloudy and then clear up??? I assume its from where the keg/bottle has been filled from the holding vessel. Regardless of haziness, the beer has a beautiful orange meets graveyard western sky color, nice white head, not too big. I love to look at the clear pour of this beer as it can be as smooth as glass. The only reason I didnt give it a perfect score is because the look of the beer is inconsistent.

Huge citrus and pine scent up front. Its as if Mr. Coniferous and Ms. Tangerine ran into each other and suddenly melted on under the hot Chicago sun (in July/August). Lying underneath them would be high quality 2-row malt that is scooping them up. Next to Hopslam this is one of my favorite smelling beers.

Over and over again this beer collapses my palate with piney and citrusy hops. It never gets old. The light body makes this beer super drinkable Love it! Amazingly I never taste the bite of alcohol. Maybe its just me???

Its simply and IIPA fans IIPA.
Bottle. Pours clear amber/orange. Citrus, pine, and caramel aromas. Tastes of citrus hops (grapefruit) balanced with malt (sweetness). Medium body with creamy texture. Well balanced. Great DIPA.
A citrus hop bomb.  Tons of grapefruit dominate the palate while bitter hops wreak havoc on thy taste buds.  Id like a little more malt sweetness to balance out ye old bitterness.
Pours orange with big white head..great hopps with pine arouma and strong sour grapfruit citrus taste,.. Long lasting strong aftertaste..
Fantastic IPA!! Super hoppy with a nice sweet citrus, bitter thang going on. A great sipper.

Poured from a 22oz bottle. Burnt orange color with a lingering off white head. Aroma is piney, grapefruit, and exotic fruit. Taste is resinous hops, citrus, and pine with a strong malt backbone. Medium mouthfeel. Best in show for Imperial I.P.A.s.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.

A.  Pours a dark apple hue, with a 2mm head, rests at a misty light island of head with a 1mm ring.

S.  Smells of sweet citrus, mango, light pine and pineapple.

T.  Tastes of sweet citrus, mango, tons of orange peel and a lot of pine to finish it off.

M.  Medium body, tiny bit chewy and a very wet finish.

O.  A fine beer.  Well balanced, lots of flavor and very refreshing.  A good beer any IPA lover should try fresh.  Its not the same when its older.

A  Transparent golden orange with little to-no head.  A light, white lacing line appears on this DIPA.

S  Pine, peaches, grapefruit Hop oil, smells sweet, yet bitter.

T  Big on the hops, but still well balanced.  The malts provide a much needed sweet tone that helps the hops not overpower the flavor.  Grainy, citrus bite, but still likeably sweet.

M  Light carbonation and a creamy texture.  Very pleasant for a big DIPA speaking of which, the alcohol is warming, but still well hidden (and is also a bit of a creeper).

O  Very well balanced for being so hoppy.  I cannot believe it took me so long to try this brew.

Pours a honey color with a head that lasts. Great aroma of citrus. Nice, hoppy after taste. Smooth drink ability. This is a great beer, certainly worth trying, but I prefer Bells Hopslam over this one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is probably the best imperial/double IPA I have tried. The a comparable beer is Piny the Elder, which is itself extremely respectable. Dreadnaught is strong, aromatic, balanced, elegant and hoppy at once. The label art from Three Floyds is always awesome. Its just great. Go there and drink it.

Light brownish tan and hazy, head was about a finger and lace was decent.  Smell was less than I had expected from such a highly rated beer.  It had pine, citrus, hops and lots of pungent malts, but had a sort of "wet dog" smell that I found a bit odd.  Taste is boldly hoppy, plenty of pungent malts, grapefruit and pine, citrus peel bitterness on the follow through.  Body is really nice, full and creamy, with a touch of sweet, aftertaste isnt as bitter as I would have thought.  Nice.  Its certainly a worthwhile beer for any hophead.  I will definitely leave this on my wants list.

22oz bomber from Binnys poured into a snifter. Pours a very lightly cloudy burnt orange with about a finger of thick frothy head. Great lacing. Aroma of lots of citrus hops and a decent bit of caramel. Taste is heavy bitter. Lots of citrus and bitter grapefruit hops with a nice touch of caramel. Full bodied with a thick yet slick texture. Lively carbonation and a very long, very bitter finish. Overall, this one is great. I would love to have it again.

22 oz bottle from Secret Santa, Christmas 2011. This was a major Want List item. Pours a slightly hazy orange/yellow, think not quite ripe orange, with a one finger creamy white head, which slowly receded, leaving gobs of lace. Fruity, citrus hops aromas assault the nose the second the cap is popped.Obviously, the flavor is dominated by citrus hops, but not so much as to be overwhelming. The malt backbone is barely there, but, there enough to prevent this from being a palate destroying hop monster. Full, oily palate with plenty of pucker, and needless to say, a bitter finish. Be cautious, the 9.5% abv is well hidden. Loved this.

On tap at Jackie-Os. We had several tulips ($5 each) of this stuff, it became a quick go-to. Mild hazy orange color, great sticky off-white head. Really nice, clean fruity taste in this. Great tropical hoppy nose. Orange, peach, grapefruit. Awesome light carbonation. Very crisp, seemingly light body and good dryness. Delicious tangy sweetness. 10% ABV is very surprising and totally undetectable here. Drinks like a regular IPA.

Pours a clear dark orange, good amount of very fine white foam. Aroma is floral and hoppy, with some citrus fruit. Taste is hoppy but sweet, lots of complex flavors, and getting bitter on the finish. Feels rather thick and oily in the mouth, in a good way. Wonderful stuff.
One of my favorite ipas. Not over the top with hops but definitely hoppy. If you cant get zombie dust this is a good replacement

~Well they are right about the mango, peach, and citrus hop aroma, which is very pleasant and quite pronounced right up in the nostrils, caramel malt in background.
~Pours a beautiful hazy orange color with small creamy white head.
~Strong orange hoppy flavor with pine and citrus. Almost cloyingly sweet malt in background. Not super bitter which is nice.
~Medium heavy feel with medium CO2, lasting piney hop finish. 
~Great aroma! This is a delicious IIPA. I think I like it bitter than others because it isnt overly bitter. The malt is a bit cloying to mask the bitterness, but it was still pulled off fairly well. Glad I got to try this beer.
Beautiful, crisp IPA with enough malt and alcohol to support the hoppiness. This beer goes down easy wven for those that are not bitterbomb fans.
Other reviewers described its character well, I will just say I cannot think of any way this beer can be improved.  It is what all other ipas strive to be.  Delicious.

Bottle thanks to madvike.  Finally getting around to trying this one.  Big resinous piney aroma, jumped out of the glass in classic FFF fashion.  I could smell this the moment I cracked the bottle.  Big fluffy white head that literally stuck around for the entire bottle.  Quite impressive.  Big piney, peach, mango flavors capped with a light bittersweet finish.  The sweetness was held in check big time making this dangerously drinkable.  Soft on the palate while having decent carbonation.  Loved the fact that this wasnt overly bitter.  As advertised.

Had it for the first time and man was it tasty!  Big mango and peachy flavors. The nose on this  beer is absolutely insane!  Other than Hopslam this is my favotite DIPA!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 22oz bottle.  Pours golden orange hue with loads of lacing left by the white head.  Aroma is grapefruit.  Taste is grapefruit and a bit of bitterness in the backend.  Really tasty...very similar to Alpine Exponential Hoppiness.
Very great IPA. Perfect hop profile, great, almost soft mouthfeel. Citrusy, grapefruit finish. Beautiful.

650 mL bottle from my buddy Dave.  Thanks, David!  Paler than expected, with a nice white head.  Big pineapple aroma with a touch of caramel and some sharpness from the booze.  The flavour is just as big, again with huge pineapple.  Tastes fresh.  The booze in the finish adds complexity and body.  Great body.  Not the most bitter IIPA Ive ever tried, but easily one of the best.
Easily one of the beat ipas I have had, got it on draft in a sniffed the head was beautiful and it settled great the aroma and smell were top notch definately a reccomended beer.
In bottiglia, francamente mi aspettavo di meglio, comunque buona ma non allaltezza delle aspettative.
UPDATED: DEC 23, 2011 Pours gold-orange with a thick tan head.  Smells very much like citrus.  Drinks (surprisingly) somewhat thick and smooth with a slightly crisp end.  Very good brew.
Mango and citrus aroma. Taste is very complex with mango, bitter sweet citrus, something spicy, not sure what. Great combination of flavours that really stands out!

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2011 Orange coulored beer, a good sticky and decent sized head. Smell of fruits, both citrus and dark, both sour and sweet, combined with a good biterness.   The smell had a bit if spices in it, that makes it a bit less, but the taste is very well mixed and nicely full of flavor. Good body and carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Draft in a snifter. Pours clear golden with white head and average lacing. Nose is pine. Aroma is pine. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a hoppy and dry finish.  Probably the textbook definition for IPA. 3.4
 
Rerate on 1/23/16. Mint for sure. A ton of mint. I get the IPA too dont worry.

I absolutely love Bells Hopslam; but 3 Floyds has me thinking that Dreadnaught might be able to go neck and neck with Hopslam. A fantastic double IPA! that goes directly into my Top 5.  Hazy gold pour with white head and decent lacing. Smell is citrusy and tropical. Taste is  unbelievably wonderful with a nice balance of hops and malts.  THREE FLOYDS PLEASE COME TO IOWA!!!!

Bottle split with mcberko. Pour a hazy dark orange with a small dissipating white head. Aroma has tons of tropical fruits (mango, pineapple and orange), caramel and loads of hops. Flavour of lots of tropical fruits, as aforementioned, hops and lots of caramel malt backing. Full-bodied, well-balanced and really nice overall.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Hazy honey-gold with moderate stark white head and nice lacing.

Aroma: Mango, lemon and grapefruit. Very tropical. Some caramel malts underneath. Aroma is a mix of dry, sweet and tart.

Taste: Unbelievably fantastic balance of tropical hops (grapefruit, lemon, mango, peach, orange) and semi-sweet caramel and toasted malts. Slight weed-like characteristics. Finishes spicy and just somewhat bitter.

Palate: Quite simply, the smoothest and creamiest DIPA I have ever had. Moderately low carbonation enhances the smooth feel, but the dry, warming finish seals the deal.

Overall: Does this rival Hopslam as the best DIPA I have had? I think it just might. Damn their limited distribution.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Pale golden orange hue pour thin white head decent sticky lacing  ..... aroma is citrusy and mango all the way, peach great aroma just a tad bit piney.... taste is of bitter and sweet citrusy hops, mango and peach with a bitter hop from beginning to end ... has some malt in the back end but just a great flavor of citrusy hops little piney just a tad sugary ... slight hop oil mouthfeel ....  finish is a lingering bitter dry hopped bite definitely showing the 100IBUs in the finish  .... abv hidden well ... impressive stuff between this and arctic panzerwolf they are a toss up for which is better

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2011 22 oz. bottle, split with Matts_Property, pours a beautiful opaque dark orange with a small white head. Aroma screams tropical fruits, with peaches, mango, mandarin oranges, truckloads of citrus and resinous hops, and rich caramel malts to balance. Flavour is omnipotent, with rich tropical fruits as aforementioned, loads of citrus and resinous hops, balanced by sufficient caramel malts, finishing tropical fruity and citrus hoppy. Magnificently well-done IIPA. Deserving of its reputation.

Pours clear gold siwth 1 finger head and perfect retention.  Aroma is peach and mango, intense hop cheesiness, light caramel, hint of toast, citrus resin.  Taste is nuts, resin, caramel, pine, toffee, mango.  Body is light to medium, low carbonation, oily mouthfeel, bitter fruity finish.  Overall, this is the beer that started it all for me.  When I first sipped this masterpiece five years ago, I had no idea how good beer could be.

A sublime experience starting with the honey-colored pour, thick with wafts of orange-blossom and lemongrass lifted on the generous white foam.  Medium bodied in the mouth but lively with spicy alcohol, burst of lime and orange hop mellowed with a sweet sticky malt.  Sexy beer.  Cheers to my brutha "Funky-B" for this fine brew.

Dreadnaught is a hop bomb for tastebuds.  If you drink this, your flavor radar is shorted out for the rest of the night.  It was a sort of grapefruit aspect that isnt always a crowd pleaser, but I liked it.

Mustig fruktdoft, tjock vätska med fantastisk stor smak av citrus och apelsin. Fin balans och trevlig lång gräsig eftersmak.
En ypperlig DIPA

UPDATED: APR 3, 2012 I have been looking forward to trying this beer for a long time.  From the 11/2011 3R6P tasting. +++ Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a slightly hazy apricot color with a medium sized white head that faded quickly and left a touch of lacing. The aroma was sweet pine, pineapple and orange. The flavor was sweet, tart and a bit our with fairly strong pineapple and pine and light orange and lemon. There were undertones of caramel and floral hops. The finish was medium length tangy mixed hops. Fairly full bodied. Quite nice but no all of what I had hoped.

Serving: Bottle from Labonix.  Thanks Zach!  It pours a slightly hazy, light gold with a nice white head.  The nose is powerfully hoppy with some pine and tropical fruit notes.  The flavor is very well balanced with notes of pine, light resin, some peach, and starfruit from the hop side.  The malt gives some light caramel and a smooth mouthfeel.  Medium bodied with average carbonation and a lingering bitter finish.  This brew is beautifully balanced.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 Aroma is big piney resiny hops, faint malt.
Flavour is intense hoppy, bitter and sweet, full and subtle, very nice balance. Great beer.

Bottle, thanks for sharing dEnk. Hazy orange pour, thin white head. Aroma full of hops, floral, fruity, grapefruit and pine. Flavor is subtle bitter and in perfect balance. Not very outspoken, but excelling in subtlety. Awesome IIPA.

I received a bomber of this in a trade.  It was poured into a footed tulip glass.  This double IPA pours a very beautiful amber-reddish color with a strong, 1 & 1/2 finger head that leaves very sturdy lacing down the glass.  The aroma is a fruit bomb with pineapple, grapefruit, mango and pear.  You can smell a sweet malt as well in the nose, mixing with the fruit.  On the palate, the beer is smooth with a pleasing carbonation that carries flavors of tropical fruit, pungent hops and a caramel-like malt backbone.  It finishes somewhat sweet.  This was an intensely fruity and very enjoyable double IPA that I found to be just a touch on the sweet side for me.  I wasnt too surprised by the sweetness because it seems to me that a lot of their beers are on the sweeter side.  Nonetheless, a very smooth and tasty example of the style.
UPDATED: JAN 4, 2012 Date: October 22, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Darkness Day. Full description not available as I sampled way too many beers during Darkness Day!
On tap. Clear yellow color with white lacing. Flavor is strong bitterness with noticeable sweetness.

Bottle provided by FullObs...Thanks ! :) ....It pours hazy golden with a medium creamy white head..... the aroma is nice fruity, peach, pine, citrus....the flavor is sweet, with lots of fresh fruit, peach, pine and citrus...... very nice finish....lots of fruits.... Medium bodied....It is very balanced......

Bottle from Marshall during Jeffs bachelor party.  Hazy,almost opaque light gold with a thin thight head that left a ton of lace down the glass.  Aroma of a flower garden, some anise, mangos, wheat, lemon rind, and pine grease.  Taste was an explosion of pine resin, with floral herbs rushing in, anise, some warm booziness, other tropical fruity hops, with an interesting, albiet subtle, caramalt backbone.  A little overtly boozy with a bit too much alpha acidity.  Everyone else adored it.  I felt ambivalent.

Bottled. Pale amber colour, creamy and lacy head. Aroma: full of hops! Starts piney when chilled, has more citrus fruits, mango and floral nectars when warmer. Light caramelly touch on the nose. Very nice malt body, not sugary or cloying. Not particularly bitter, but it has very nice, wide hop flavor. Very smoot, velvety texture. Lovely beer with amazing drinkability.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 This beer is ridiculous...ly good.  Pours a golden color with white head and lacing that will not go away.  Aroma of grassy hops.  Taste is complex with hints of citrus, grapefruit, bitter hops, and I think very faint sweet carmel.  Awesome.

Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar on October 15. Pours hazy golden with a thick white head that leaves lots of trace on the glass as it dissipates. Smell is sweet wth some bread, tropical fruits like peaches, apricots, papaya and passionfruit. Theres also slight notes of vanilla and a clear tingling smell of alcohol. Taste is incredibly smooth and well balanced with resin, pine, orange zest, mango, kiwifruit, vanilla taffy, freshly cut wood and some honey. Finish is smooth and bitter with some grapefruit. A really good beer thats incredibly balanced. Could drink this all day every day!

Poured from a bomber into a tulip glass. Appearance is a nice translucent orange with a sticky white head of foam that leaves perfect lacing as you work your way through the glass. Drinking this beer doesnt really constitute working, though. Aroma is filled with hops. I get oranges, grapefruit rind, resin, and flowers. The taste accumulates all of the accents of the aroma, but portrays them in a fantastic way. The fruity note of the aroma turn into a peach and mango collision while the grapefruit rind moves more to the end of drink in a smooth transition. The resin detected in the aroma disappears from the taste. Mouthfeel is sticky with the medium to full body. Soft carbonation. Finish is long and juicy. Definitely a beer to pick up if the opportunity presents itself.

I brought this one to our IPA day party.
A - Pours slightly hazed golden yellow with a nice pillow of one finger tall white head leaving small beads of lace down the glass.
S - Smells of a mix of grassy and citric hops, tropical fruits; mostly grapefruit and pineapple; and some light sweetness from the lightly toasted caramel malt.
T - Starts off with a nice dose of grassy hops quickly giving way to a mix of even more citric hops, pineapple, grapefruit, and the ever present caramel malt. I am glad I drank this one when I did as it seems like the sweetness is growing quickly, swallowing up the juicy hops. The finish is a mix of hop bitterness and caramel sweetness, lingering for a short period of time.
M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Slick, hoppy, feel with plenty of it lingering through the finish.
O - When fresh, this one is hard to beat. It is very well balanced and has plenty of hops for even the most fervent hop head. I hope to try this one on-tap someday and really give it a proper going over.

Pours dark gold with thick white head, nice lacing in my snifter, aroma is not as strong as the arctic panzer wolf I just finished, more subtle, but still a hop bomb,fruity citrus notes, small toffee malt notes. Taste is smooth and not so harsh as some DIPAS, sour/bitter peach flavor and a bit of pine, some caaramel, slick mouthfeel, thank you 3 floyds!

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2011 This beer is full of overipe fruit notes coming from the mix of both malts and sweet hops. It is a very smooth beer. It is not the best IIpa I have had but it does well balancing the hops. After having one at a cooler temperature I realize the complexities of this beer a little better.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a glass.  Pours clear light orange with small white head.  Some small bubble lacing, medium body, medium carbonation and slightly slick texture.  Taste is complex grapefruit, grass, and finishes bitter hops.

Pours hazy golden with big white creamy head.  Aroma is a everything you want, tons of fruity and citrus hop notes.  Taste is more hops with plenty of citrus character but well-balanced by a big malt backbone.  Very firm bitterness on the finish.  This is a superb beer that will wreck your taste buds.  Definitely a punch in the face if you drink a bomber by yourself.

22 oz bomber from a trade (thanks Mike). Feeling like some hops - and this did the trick. Poured into my Three Floyds snifter (too small). Color is amber with a modest white head and nice lacing. Well carbed bubbles adds to the nose of hoppy grapefruit, lemon and pine. Taste has a sweetness with nice grapefruit and bitter hop bombs. Finishes with a slight malt backbone. This is an nice Impy IPA..Switching to a pint glass to enjoy it faster.

Poured from a bomber into a tulip.  Great deep amber color with a white head.  Aroma is a wallop of citrusy hops, with a hint of pine.  Taste is similarly awesome, lots of citrusy hops, particularly grapefruit, with a hint of pine and nice malt support that doesnt steal the show from those wonderful hops.  Goes down nice and smooth for a brew this hoppy, decent body but not too big, perfect mouthfeel.  This is beervana, instantly soared to the top of the list of my favorite brews.

Fuckin finally!  Three Floyds is finally starting to pop up in Ohio!  At least in the Cincinnati area.  Of course this beers reputation precedes it, and does not fail!  Excellent DIPA that delivers a full assault on the taste buds.  Oddly enough, I couldnt really detect that powerful of an aroma.  Smooth as hell!  Good first impression from TF.

Draught at Mikkeler Bar 1105
Hazy golden with a small, white head.
Sweet, creamy, fruity aroma with tropical fruits.
Medium bitterness. Soft and smooth palate.
Loads of tropical fruits in the flavour.

What reallyatracted me to this beer is how light it is, it is not overly bitter. Only slightly more impure than a regular IPA, and the alcohol doesnt stand out either. Lots of golden wheat flavor, artisan bread, sweet citrus hops balanced with earthiness. Good stuff, and brewed only 11 days ago. Bottle from chucks in bowling green, ky.

Pours a golden orange color...clear and lively...huge white head...excellent retention and lacing.  Aroma is fruity...peach...citrusy and sweet...orange blossom.  Flavor is freshly hoppy with lots of citrus notes...peach, pineapple...significant malt backing.  Mothfeel is chewy and lively with a bitter dry citrus/spice finish.  Wow!  Did somebody just squeeze fresh hop resin into a glass?  This beer is the real deal!

(22 oz. bottle via trade with pantanap, thanks Kan!) Pours hazy orange-amber with a finger or so of off-white head that recedes to a thin covering. Aroma of big citrus and pine over big caramel-vanilla and bread maltiness. Mouthfeel big, smooth and full. Weepy light rings and a syrupy film inside. Flavor of big citrusy and lighter pine hoppiness over big smooth caramel-vanilla with bready and light sweat undertones. Big massive but very smooth and delicious big IPA.

Bottle. Mmmmm...this is good stuff. Intense hoppy smell, apricot, citrus, resin, floral perfume. Taste of peach and apricot jam, pineapple, resin, caramel. Medium to full bodied, creamy mouthfeel. A very seducing beer.
Poured from a bottle. Lovely citrusy hop aroma. More citrus in the flavor, with a solid malt backbone. Tasty IPA!

Glass, 5-ounce, on the premise, savoured on July 7 2011; eye: caramel, lightly hazy, no effervescence, tiny ring of off-white head; nose: resinous hops, floral, orange, caramel, tropical fruits; mouth: resinous hops, floral, orange, caramel, tropical fruits, light alcohol, finale in resinous hops with light presence of orange, full body, rather bitter but soft at the same time, average carbonation, mildly sweet, grainy texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS 

Verre, 5 onces, à la brasserie, savourée le 7 juillet 2011; il : caramel, légèrement voilée, pas deffervescence, petit anneau de mousse blanc cassé; nez : houblon résineux, floral, orange, caramel, fruits tropicaux; bouche : houblon résineux, floral, orange, caramel, fruits tropicaux, léger alcool, finale en houblon résineux avec légère présence dorange, corsée, plutôt amère mais douce en même temps, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture granuleuse; en résumé : bien bon

A very good IIPA, I would probably drink this beer much more often if it were more reasonably priced. This beer pours a nice bright orange, with a fizzy white head that fades quickly and leaves a slight lacing. It is a nice floral fruity beer that is smooth balanced and easy to drink. Grab it fresh because this beers with 6 months of age is going to be a shell of its former self.

This was the first DIPA I ever had. Finally rating it. Pours a beautiful golden color with yellow hew. Nose is full of pineapple and passion fruit. First sip is malty goodness with great hop flavors. Amazing beer.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2014 The nose on this thing is as close to utter perfection as Ive ever experienced. The description on the bottle does not do it justice. The hops are nothing short of perfect, and the strong malts make for a perfect complement, resulting in a spectacular, harmonious orchestra of tropical fruits (mango, peach, pineapple), citrus, flowers, and pine. The taste follows these notes, making for a bitter and, to a lesser degree, sweet impression on the tongue. You might think this is a really strong and overpowering drink, what with the 9.5% abv and the 100 IBUs, but this really drinks like orange juiceif you can withstand the sourness of the citrus in your stomach, you can drink until you pass the f*ck out. The only thing that, in my opinion, keeps this beer from true glory is the thin palate. I was expecting a much thicker feel, especially since it LOOKS thick. Carbonation is on the weaker side, but I attribute this to shipping and handling. I did expect a little more viscosity, though.

On tap at GTMW - Pours amber with a small white head. Huge citrus nose with tropical fruitiness and a sweet malt base. Well-balanced. Taste is a little limper, with the same sweet bready malt and a citrus/perfume hop mix. Its a little sharp and bitter, and just not the hop profile I like. Full-bodied with nice carbonation and a slickness to it. Good, but not blown away by this one like I used to be.

Bebida en Map room ,Chicago.
cerveza con toques cítricos,muy buen balance entre malta y lúpulo,el alcohol esta presente pero no molesta,muy buena espuma con buenos encajes de bruselas.Muy buena imperial ipa!

Pours a nice medium golden colour with a nice size head. Aroma starts strong pine and citrus and then more mango grapefruit aroma comes out and a little caramel. Taste is a nice pine with a heavy dry bitterness and a litte sweet malty undertone. very enjoyable

Bottle: Orange pour  with a thin head.
Aroma is strong grapefruit, caramel and peaches under that. 
Flavour is resinous pine, medium sweet toasted malt backbone. Alc is well blended. Finishes dry.

smuggled on a flight back from Chitown- pours clear golden, fluffy two finger head with great retention and lacing. persistent bubbles flowing from the center of the glass. N- passion fruit, guava,mango, pineapple, so damn fruity. esters, toasted malts, pine T- citrus hops, caramel and resin malts. up front bitterness that mellows over the finish. This is true balance in a beer. One of Three Floyds best.

A fresh bottle for once!!!  Clear golden in color with a medium sized white head.  Big grapefruit, lemon, and citrus aroma.  Flavor is excellently balanced with a slightly bitter finish.  Candied grapefruit, pine, resinous hop notes.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2012 The best of the best of the best, sir! With honors! An absurdly delicious IPA! Pick some up!

Tap at the pub.  Aroma: lots of citrus and tropical fruit; mango and grapefruit, very floral, some pine sap, malty sweetness in the background.  Pours a clear golden color, nice white head with good retention and lots of clumpy lacing.  Flavor is bursting with hops, tons of mango, puckering grapefruit, sweet resiny pine sap, nice toasty and caramel malt to support the hops.  Bitterness if obviously quite high, but the malt keeps it somewhat under control and there is minimal astringent bitter aftertaste.  Medium body and carbonation, very smooth.  Killer IIPA, hard to beat this one when its fresh.

08/05 0.65 l bottle courtesy of ogivlado, great thanks for sharing! Poured hazy dusky orange body with medium sized ivory head. Very nice aroma of standard citrus hops,  Fine orange flavor, slightly evened with some vanilla and caramel malt, but still predominately bitter. Alcohol is felt as well. Medium in body, with longer hoppy herbal and orange finish. Warming. Not a bad beer, though didnt like it as most of other IIPAs. Too alcoholic, while missed complexity.

Bomber, pours pistine gold w/ sticky white head, massive hop aroma of mango, resin, caramel malt, and some light frutiy esters, multi-layered wonderful bitterness supported by a solid malt backbone, one of the best examples of the style

Pours a clear light copper color with nice head and lacing.  Aromas of grapefruit, floral, and a little caramel sweetness.  Taste is a wonderfully mild sweetness with a bitterness that builds throughout to a great long, dry finish.  Overall, this is one great beer.  It has everything with the balance of hops and malts, bitterness to sweetness.  FFF does it again.

Where to start...the most impressive part of this beer for me was the hop wallop at the beginning, which lit up the tip of my tongue and subsided just enough to allow the malt sweetness to make an appearance. I did get some of the mango and peach on the aroma, but improper glassware probably inhibited this part of the experience for me. Of the 3 Three Floyds DIPAs Ive now tried (Apocalypse Cow, Arctic Panzer Wolf), I would say this is the most balanced. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2016 Re rate!  Not sure what I was thinking on the original rate.  Much better this time around.  Clear orange pour with a single finger head, lace present.  Aroma of grapefruit.  Medium to full bodied.  Very bitter.  Grapefruit and grapefruit pith.  Intensely bitter, finishes dry.  Tasty, but maybe a little overboard.

Original Rate: I wasnt overly impressed with this.  Hopefully it was just a bad bottle.  Amber color, really sugary fruity aroma.  My pour had almost not head whatsoever.  Syrupy in the mouth.  Really sweet at first with a nice bitter backend.  This is a very complex beer!  22oz bomber poured into a tulip.

Bottled, tasting @ cgarvieuk. Happy to be able to try this. Hazy golden colour, white head. Nose is pine, resin, flowery, mandarines. Flavour is pine hops, flowery and fruity. Dry and bitter finish. Lots going on in here.

Bottle at cgarvieuks. Mmm. Clear gold colour, with a massive 1.5 finger head. Very complex aroma, orange, pine, a touch of peach but most notably, a distinctive mandarin. Taste is again complex, sweet, tropical, fruity with lots of hop bitterness, as well as caramel and alcohol. Semi-syrupy mouthfeel and a lingering bitterness, too. This is very, very good.

Bottle at cgarvieuks. Slightly cloudy yellow/orange with a big foamy white head. Big mandarin nose, peach and pine too. Super-fruity. Sweet front but definitely hop-heavy throughout. Long bitter linger. Lovely, balanced and slightly unusual.

I drove to Munster, IN today to pick up 3 22oz bottles of these (and a case of Alpha King), and have just tried 
my first Dreadnaught.  All I can say is Wow!  This lives up to the hype.   Ive never tried another IPA/IIPA/double IPA that has an aroma of pine.  (Although grapefruit is in the aroma, too).  Theres a considerable white head that lasted a couple minutes after I poured it into a glass, above a somewhat cloudy orange color.  The taste is "a hopheads dream beer" as promised, but with lots of citrus surprises.  Much more satisfying than the same brewerys Arctic Panzer Wolf (which was good, but not fantastic like this).  Like my favorite movies and jazz records, I expect Ill discover a few things I missed the 2nd or 3rd times around.  Ill gladly come back to this one.
At Quenchers. Big hoppy IPA, but malted enough to balance well. Caramel and citrus-y hops. Serving: Tap

In bottle at Craigs. A light golden colour with a thick white head. Huge juicy mandarin nose! Come on dig two thumbs in. Juicy, orange and mandarin flavours with some bubblegum and candy sugar. Fruity and a little sweet with a nice bitter linger : )

Light soapy aroma with tropical fruits, lemon and grapefruit, smell is incredible. Appearance is very pale with fluffy white head. Taste is full on, mandarin pineapple lemon. Fairly bitter finish. Top notch

Bomber.  Pours a hazy golden hue, middling foam and lots of bubbling up the sides of the glass.  Aroma is a rich blend of hops and malt.  Nice pine and fruit mix on the hop profile from the nose.  Pine hops assault the roof of my mouth on the first sip, and then sweet fruits kick in from mid to late palate, rolling down my tongue and throat.  Malt presence is a sweet backdrop to this play, and make the whole composition work.  Falls short of Piny on a number of levels, but has to be in the top few DIPAs Ive had.  A silky smooth 9.5%, with all kinds of skill and care on display.  This is a great beer.
7/10 i mörkhet. Väldigt fruktig och frisk i lukten. Frisk, fruktig och besk i smaken. Besk eftersmak.

22oz bottle - thanks Matt. Amber with a nice white head. Great fruity hops, bit of citrus, hugely smooth, nice and "soapy", no alcohol to speak off. Nice creamy bitterness, smooth like the aroma, great carbonation, full-bodied with a finish that keeps on going and going. Mmmmmm - quite delicious and wish I could get this on a regular basis.

Pours a nice golden yellow with an immense, pillowy head that lasts and lasts. Surprisingly smooth for such an over-hopped beer. The hop bite isnt as pronounced as in some double IPAs Ive tried. The aroma is a very piney, fresh, elevated hops one. Flavor includes the obvious citrus, but with other fruit notes are present as well. This is well worth your time and trouble to track down.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 Semblable à la Double trouble mais plus fruité. Le pamplemousse domine, très amer avec une belle rondeur malté au fini.

22oz bottle, unknown date.  Served at around 45-50F.

Pours lightly hazy burnt gold with a three finger foamy white head that leaves a couple of rings of foamy lace and holds a small cap.

Aroma is peaches, grapefruit citrus, some pineapple and mango along with good grassy and herbal notes.  Some mild malt peeks through but the hops are the star here.  Good to very good strength.

Flavor is tropical fruits of pineapple and mango, some lemon and grapefruit citrus rind, peach and apricot, giving way to some caramel and bready malt that offers a touch of sweetness which is then swept away by a wave of hop bitterness.  Some alcohol is noted but isnt solvent or biting.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, oily and slick, low-medium carbonation.

A superb DIPA, very tasty and a huge want for a long time.  Thrilled to have the chance to finally try this.  However, I have to throw in the obligatory ranking amongst top-tier DIPAs, and for me, this is very good but not the best Ive had.  Doesnt crack my Top 5, but probably within my Top 10.

Bottle from DLD thanks to Andrew for purchasing this. I had no idea that this was this good. Poured clear golden brown with small head. Aroma is mostly of citrus with a hint of pine. Very balanced flavour with very smooth finish. I didnt get as much pine as the others, but really really great beer! One of the best double IPAs I have ever had.

amazing pine/citrus and malt aroma, easily the best aroma of any beer ive ever had. i think the bottle we had was a little old but it was still awesome. many fruity flavours with the pine and citrus hops along with a nice malt backbone. lots of bitterness, but a very palatable bitterness. really want to find more of this beer.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2011 Bottle, pours a nice dark pale colour, smell was just about as good as it gets. it was really nice of citrusy and a little bit piney as well. Really great brew. The was very bitter but it was also very malty and it was just a great mix. really amazing beer.
650 ml bottle that poors a hazy orange that has a small beige head.  Smells of tropical fruit.  Tastes of hops and mango, amazing flavor and realy good for a bbq outside.

Pours from bottle a clear golden with a medium white head.  Aroma pours out with a hoppy pine and citrus together with a mild caramel maltiness.  Flavor is nice with a mild sweetness moving toward a mild bitter, with a big pine, citrus, some grapefruit, and light caramel.  This beer make for some nice sipping and hides the alcohol well.

Bottle thanks to DVD!  Pours a nice amber color with a smallish head. The aroma hits you with a bouquet of powerul hops; citrus and orange everywhere!.  The flavor is a lush river of oranges, grapefruit, resiny hops and a just the slightly known hint of alcohol.  Quite bitter, but still a nice balanced beer for the IBUs and ABV.  Overall, I am sad that it will most likely be a long time before I get to taste this one again.  Fantastic!

UPDATED: APR 17, 2015 Pours a very nice hazy amber with a solid beige head. Aroma of juicy hops all the way. exotic fruits like mango, orange, pineapple, peach, and passionfruit. There is also some pine and a light malt sweetness . Taste of juicy hops along with all the exotic tropical fruits from the aroma, very weak caramel, grapefruit, citrus, some apples and a weak bread crust note leading to a dry bitter fresh finish. Wow!

Draught, 200ml nicely served at Mikkeller Bar. Hazy, copper coloured body. Small ring of bubbles to the edge of the glass. Inviting aroma of fresh citric and tropical fruits. Fruit hoppy taste of grapefruits and oranges, resinous hops and chocolate fruity. Dry bitter aftertaste. A really skillful blended brew. Just delicious (Copenhagen, 26.05.2011).

Vollmundig süß hopfiger Geruch, passend, überaus aromatisch. Aromatisch hopfig-herber Antrunk, sehr intensiv aber nicht übertrieben. Weiter deutlich hopfig, der amerikanische Hopfen ist deutlich schmeckbar und passt mit seinem intensiven, fast scharfen Auftreten gut dazu. Der Alkohol ist im Abgang kurz erkennbar, vollmundig hopfig, sehr kräftig, gut gelungen. Abwechslungsreiches und sehr starkes IIPA mit sporadisch auftretenden Fruchtnoten. Spitze! 	 
Test vom 29.9.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,14,12,13,12,13 - 12,95
Tap @ MikkellerBar. Slightly hazy golden with small white head. Flavour is malt, hops, bitter, citrus, pine, fruit, peach and grape.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2011 Tap @ Three Floyds. Clear golden pour with a white, fluffy head which fades quickly to leave heavy lace. Fruity, resinous hop nose. Solid, medium-heavy body with creamy carbonation. Pine resin, peach, bitter chocolate and caramel, this is lovely. Every bit the equal of PtE and at this range edges it out. Will see how well a bottle travels. Slight alcohol burn is the only drawback for me.
Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and very hoppy - peach and grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Crisp. 250511

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Golden beer with a nice lasting white head. Creamy aroma, hoppy, grassy, metal notes, grapes, grapefruit and nice notes of pine apple. Fruity hoppy flavor, grapes, metal notes, creamy, some hay, grass and apples. Long bitter metal finish with perfume and fruity notes. Incredibly complex and tasty.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2011 Very good Imperial IPA.  The hops were clean and fresh with a strong bitter finish.  Had a warming booze effect that seemed a bit stronger then the actual ABV.  One of the better beers I have had of the style.  My only complaint was the finish wasnt as smooth as I would have liked.

EDIT:  Tried a brand new fresh bottle and am upping my rating from a 4.2 to 4.6.  Amazingly smooth with great citrus flavors and well balanced sweetness.  One of the best beers Ive ever had.

when I saw this beer on tap at local option was a lot I was a very happy human. The aroma strikes with citrus, malt and a lot of hops. It pours a wonderful sun burnt orange with creamy white head. The mouthfeel is pretty standard but the mango and/ or peach really gives it a unique hop quality. Amazing beer. Amazing bar.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Three Floyds Event. Pours a nice coppe color with a small off white head. Aroma is quite hoppy with loads of fresh hoppy notes with grapefruit, tropical fruits particularily pineapple, peach, tangerine orange zest and citrus fruits. The flavor is super hoppy yet quite balanced with loads of grapefruit, peach and tropical fruits, along with a sweet malty backbone, the orange zest and tangerine. The body is medium with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a great DIPA!
clody orange, small white head. Fruity aroma, exotic and grapr. Fresh.7 flavor is super well balanced dry , bitter and fruity hops. Good malty base. Perfect and still mild, quenching

UPDATED: APR 21, 2014 Bottle shared at tasting.  Clear light amber pour with little head.  Strong fruit aroma of grapefruit and peaches.  Soft hoppy taste with fruit.  Fine balance.

Adjusted rated after trying on draft at Mikkeler bar on 13th May 2012.  Theres such a wonderful caramel balance against the bitter hops, the aroma positively sucks you in, encouring you back for another smell, and the perfect carbonation tingles against your tongue.  This really is a fine beer, and the best of its style for me.

Bottled650ml. -Trade with shrubber85 (thanks Roger!), shared with Marko and heavy.
Hazy orange/dark golden coloured, medium to big sized white head, hoppy spicy nose. Moderate malty, grapefruity hoppy and caramel with a bit too strong warming alcohol notes. Dry bitter finish and aftertaste. Very good one but not as great as Ive expected.

It pours a light amber/straw color. Which for an Imperial IPA seems a bit too pale. No matter, I dont taste the color of beer. Big, frothy white head up top. The lacing is typical of most IIPAs in that it is there, and it dries up quickly. Which also means that it stay around for the entire drinking session. I am immediately hit with a huge hop aroma. I thought I had left a bag of hops out. It is that pungent. That is really all there is to smell. The hops definitely dominate the aroma in this beer. Which is not bad. I have smelled bad before, and this is nowhere close to it. There is the typical grapefruit citrus aroma. A little grassy. And a lot awesome. I also get a slight crystal malt aroma. The kind that is almost caramel, but just not quite, and definitely smells a bit like sugar.

The initial taste is very similar to the nose on this one. Big grapefruit citrus flavor. A bit of a floral, grassy taste on the back side. A very subdued malt flavor. The hops really are the main player in this beer. I wont say it is unbalanced, but the hops definitely outweigh the malt. A bitterness and a slight warming from the alcohol. There is a slight dryness to it, which would explain the lack of  any malt sweetness. A very bitter bite stays with me well after I swallow each sip I take. Well, its not really a sip. More like a gulp. Very floral flavor left over too, but it reminds me more of the aroma than actually tasting like flowers. Very quaff-able beer.

Bottle courtesy of ogivlado who shared it with me and heavy. Since we werent counting, it was by pure chance that this ended up being my no. 2500! Poured a hazy orange-golden body. Jammy, sweetish nose with lovely peach jam notes, some aroma hop, creamy, quite good. Strong bitter, slightly earthy taste Herbal, slightly warming, a bit fruity, slightly nutty. Ok, but not nearly as brilliant as I hoped it would be! Heck, the Pikkulintu IIPA wed had the day before runs circles around this.

This Hop Nectar is courtesy of phishpond - pours a clear amber with a medium white head that is long-lived leaving tight lacing with every drink.  Nice carbonation.  Hops, hops, hops - of grapefruits and lemons and fruits with a little pine - in the aroma with an ever-so-slight sweet floral and then a slight sweet maltiness.  Taste is nirvana in a glass - intense grapefruit bitter hops up front and in your face with a subtle malt background.  This is what an Impy IPA should be like.

220z bottle into a pint glass.  The beer pours a nice slightly cloudy yellow with a thick off-white head.  The beer leaves nice lacing on the glass, but retains the head for some time.  The nose is full of citrus hops, and grapefruit notes.  The beer is well balanced with slight maltiness on the taste, but very hop forward.  The palate is medium body and the carbonation is lively.  Beer goes down smooth and the ABV is not noticeable.  Overall, this is an outstanding DIPA.
Bottle shared by Dosbeerigos. Great aroma  of hops and malts. Good citrus hops and malts abound in the flavor and aroma. Not too overpowering in the slightest. Very drinkable and just outstanding.
An amazing ipa curious of James.  Aggressive and juicy mango, pine, and citrus.   Might be my favorite ipa

Apr 30, tap @ DLD, courtesy of pantanap. Poures amber orange with a nice thick off white head leaving some lacing. Very piny, citric and fresh aroma. Dry, hoppy, fruity, piny and still sweet flavor. Medium palate. Finishes bitter tart and a bit fruity. Must be the IPAs Ive ever tasted.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2014 Enjoyed from a bomber that was brought from a friends co-worker at Dark Lord Day at 3 Floyds in Munster, IN.  Appearance clearish golden with thin white head.  Aroma caramel malt, alcohol, a bit of sweetness.  Taste very bitter, caramel malts are prominent, alcohol is ever present, balance between barley wine and general hoppiness is impressive.  Very good.  Maybe I should try this again when my palate isnt damaged by drinking close to 60 oz of high ABV brew before drinking this.------- after enjoyed on tap at Kumas Corner.  Ive got to bump my rating up, because this was exceptionally great, and Im wondering if I had a fresher version, hence the better rating.  Definitely more abundant with the pine notes.  Great DIPA.

A couple bottles via trade the last three months.  Pours a nice deep orange with a distinct head.  The tropical fruit notes and citrus hops come through in the nose but has not blown me away.  The taste is again very much tropical fruit, pine and some citrus.  The hops are there the whole time from beginning to end.  It doesnt blast my taste buds as I had expected but it does come close.  

Im hesitant to say that I was disappointed since I still found this to be an outstanding beer but I would love to have this on draft and taste it as fresh as possible.  Or simply date the bottles so I can be sure of freshness and possible re-evaluate the bottle.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Oe of my favorite beers of all time.  Notes of tropical fruits roll nito an unbiased hit of hops that bitter into a sweeter almost beet like finish.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2011 Pure bliss. From the bottle at 3 Floyds. Aroma of a tropical punchbowl. Lots of apricot, mango, citrus, honey and caramel. Apricot really comes through in the taste, huge hops ! Superbly balanced with a massive lingering bitterness. In my eyes a perfect beer

Opaque and golden with an out of control head.  It cannot be tamed.  Thick, clumpy lacing.  The head dissipates and leaves a cloud mountain in the center.  Awesome.
